verses.latin: Quoniam quidem multi conati sunt ordinare narrationem, quae in nobis completae sunt rerum,
verses.english: Many have undertaken to draw up an account of the events that have been fulfilled among us,

verses.latin: sicut tradiderunt nobis, qui ab initio ipsi viderunt, et ministri fuerunt sermonis,
verses.english: as they were handed down to us by those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and servants of the word.

verses.latin: visum est et mihi, persequuto omnia a principio diligenter, ex ordine tibi scribere, optime Theophile,
verses.english: Therefore, since I myself have carefully investigated everything from the beginning, it seemed good also to me to write an orderly account for you, most excellent Theophilus,

verses.latin: ut cognoscas eorum verborum de quibus eruditus es, veritatem.
verses.english: so that you may know the certainty of the things you have been taught.

verses.latin: Fuit in diebus Herodis regis Judaeae, sacerdos quidam, nomine Zacharias, de vice Abia: et uxor illius de filiabus Aaron, et nomen ejus Elisabeth.
verses.english: In the time of Herod king of Judea, there was a priest named Zechariah, of the division of Abijah; and his wife was a descendant of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.

verses.latin: Erant autem justi ambo ante Deum, incedentes in omnibus mandatis et justificationibus Domini, sine querella.
verses.english: Both of them were righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blamelessly.

verses.latin: Et non erat illis filius, eo quod esset Elisabeth sterilis, et ambo processissent in diebus suis.
verses.english: But they had no children, because Elizabeth was barren, and both were advanced in years.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum sacerdotio fungeretur in ordine vicis suae ante Deum,
verses.english: Once when Zechariah was serving as priest before God in the order of his division,

verses.latin: secundum consuetudinem sacerdotii, sorte exiit ut incensum poneret, ingressus in templum Domini.
verses.english: according to the custom of the priesthood, he was chosen by lot to enter the temple of the Lord and burn incense.

verses.latin: Et omnis multitudo populi erat orans foris hora incensi.
verses.english: And the whole multitude of the people were praying outside at the hour of incense.

verses.latin: Apparuit autem illi angelus Domini, stans a dextris altaris incensi.
verses.english: Then there appeared to him an angel of the Lord, standing on the right side of the altar of incense.

verses.latin: Et Zacharias turbatus est videns, et timor irruit super eum.
verses.english: When Zechariah saw him, he was startled and was gripped with fear.

verses.latin: Ait autem illi angelus: Ne timeas, Zacharia: quoniam exaudita est oratio tua, et uxor tua Elisabeth pariet tibi filium: et vocabis nomen ejus Joannem:
verses.english: But the angel said to him: “Do not be afraid, Zechariah, for your prayer has been heard, and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you will call his name John.

verses.latin: et erit gaudium tibi et exsultatio, et multi in nativitate ejus gaudebunt.
verses.english: And you will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth,

verses.latin: Erit enim magnus coram Domino: et vinum et siceram non bibet, et Spiritu Sancto replebitur adhuc ex utero matris suae:
verses.english: because he will be great in the sight of the Lord. He will drink neither wine nor strong drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother’s womb.

verses.latin: et multos filiorum Israël convertet ad Dominum Deum ipsorum.
verses.english: And he will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord their God.

verses.latin: Et ipse praecedet ante illum in spiritu et virtute Eliae: ut convertat corda patrum in filios, et incredulos ad prudentiam justorum, parare Domino plebem perfectam.
verses.english: And he will go on before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of parents to their children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous, to make ready for the Lord a people prepared.”

verses.latin: Et dixit Zacharias ad angelum: Unde hoc sciam? ego enim sum senex, et uxor mea processit in diebus suis.
verses.english: And Zechariah said to the angel, “How shall I know this? For I am an old man, and my wife is advanced in years.”

verses.latin: Et respondens angelus dixit ei: Ego sum Gabriel, qui asto ante Deum: et missus sum loqui ad te, et evangelizare tibi haec.
verses.english: And the angel answering said to him: “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and was sent to speak to you and bring you this good news.

verses.latin: Et ecce eris tacens, et non poteris loqui usque in diem qua haec fiant, pro eo quod non credidisti verbis meis, quae implebuntur in tempore suo.
verses.english: And behold, you will be silent and unable to speak until the day that these things take place, because you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their time.”

verses.latin: Et erat plebs exspectans Zachariam: et mirabantur quod tardaret in templo.
verses.english: And the people were waiting for Zechariah, and they were wondering at his delay in the temple.

verses.latin: Egressus autem non poterat loqui ad illos: et cognoverunt quod visionem vidisset in templo. Et ipse erat innuens illis, et remansit mutus.
verses.english: When he came out, he was unable to speak to them, and they realized that he had seen a vision in the temple. And he kept making signs to them and remained mute.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum impleti sunt dies officii ejus, abiit in domum suam.
verses.english: And it came to pass that, as soon as the days of his service were completed, he departed to his own house.

verses.latin: Post dies autem illos, concepit Elisabeth uxor ejus, et occultabat se mensibus quinque, dicens:
verses.english: After those days his wife Elizabeth conceived, and for five months she kept herself hidden, saying,

verses.latin: Quia sic fecit mihi Dominus in diebus, quibus respexit auferre opprobrium meum inter homines.
verses.english: “Thus the Lord has done for me in the days when He looked on me, to take away my reproach among people.”

verses.latin: In mense autem sexto, missus est angelus Gabriel a Deo in civitatem Galilaeae, cui nomen Nazareth,
verses.english: In the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee named Nazareth,

verses.latin: ad virginem desponsatam viro, cui nomen erat Joseph, de domo David: et nomen virginis Maria.
verses.english: to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David; and the virgin's name was Mary.

verses.latin: Et ingressus angelus ad eam, dixit: Ave gratia plena: Dominus tecum: benedicta tu in mulieribus.
verses.english: And the angel came to her and said, “Hail, full of grace, the Lord is with you.” Blessed are you among women.

verses.latin: Quae cum audisset, turbata est in sermone ejus: et cogitabat qualis esset ista salutatio.
verses.english: But she was greatly troubled at the saying, and considered what sort of greeting this might be.

verses.latin: Et ait angelus ei: Ne timeas, Maria: invenisti enim gratiam apud Deum.
verses.english: Then the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.

verses.latin: Ecce concipies in utero, et paries filium: et vocabis nomen ejus Jesum.
verses.english: And behold, you will conceive in your womb and bear a son, and you will call his name Jesus.

verses.latin: Hic erit magnus, et Filius Altissimi vocabitur, et dabit illi Dominus Deus sedem David patris ejus:
verses.english: He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Most High. And the Lord God will give to Him the throne of His father David,

verses.latin: et regnabit in domo Jacob in aeternum: et regni ejus non erit finis.
verses.english: and He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and of His kingdom there will be no end.”

verses.latin: Dixit autem Maria ad angelum: Quomodo fiet istud? quoniam virum non cognosco.
verses.english: And Mary said to the angel, “How will this be, since I do not know a man?”

verses.latin: Et respondens angelus dixit ei: Spiritus Sanctus superveniet in te, et virtus Altissimi obumbrabit tibi. Ideoque et quod nascetur ex te sanctum, vocabitur Filius Dei.
verses.english: And the angel answered her, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you; therefore the child to be born will be holy—he will be called the Son of God.

verses.latin: Et ecce Elisabeth cognata tua, et ipsa concepit filium in senectute sua: et hic mensis sextus est illi, quae vocatur sterilis:
verses.english: And behold, your relative Elizabeth in her old age has also conceived a son; and this is the sixth month for her who was called barren.

verses.latin: quia non est impossibile apud Deum omne verbum.
verses.english: For nothing will be impossible with God.”

verses.latin: Dixit autem Maria: Ecce ancilla Domini: fiat mihi secundum verbum tuum. Et discessit ab illa angelus.
verses.english: And Mary said, “Behold, I am the servant of the Lord; let it be to me according to your word.” And the angel departed from her.

verses.latin: Exsurgens autem Maria in diebus illis, abiit in montana cum festinatione, in civitatem Juda:
verses.english: In those days Mary arose and went with haste into the hill country, to a city of Judah,

verses.latin: et intravit in domum Zachariae, et salutavit Elisabeth.
verses.english: and she entered the house of Zechariah and greeted Elizabeth.

verses.latin: Et factum est, ut audivit salutationem Mariae Elisabeth, exsultavit infans in utero ejus: et repleta est Spiritu Sancto Elisabeth,
verses.english: And when Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, the infant leaped in her womb; and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit,

verses.latin: et exclamavit voce magna, et dixit: Benedicta tu inter mulieres, et benedictus fructus ventris tui.
verses.english: and she cried out with a loud voice and said, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!

verses.latin: Et unde hoc mihi, ut veniat mater Domini mei ad me?
verses.english: And why is this granted to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

verses.latin: Ecce enim ut facta est vox salutationis tuae in auribus meis, exsultavit in gaudio infans in utero meo.
verses.english: For behold, as soon as the sound of your greeting came to my ears, the infant in my womb leaped for joy.

verses.latin: Et beata, quae credidisti, quoniam perficientur ea, quae dicta sunt tibi a Domino.
verses.english: And blessed is she who believed that there would be a fulfillment of what was spoken to her from the Lord.”

verses.latin: Et ait Maria: Magnificat anima mea Dominum.
verses.english: And Mary said, “My soul magnifies the Lord,

verses.latin: Et exsultavit spiritus meus in Deo salutari meo.
verses.english: and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior,

verses.latin: Quia respexit humilitatem ancillae suae: ecce enim ex hoc beata me dicent omnes generationes.
verses.english: for He has looked on the humble estate of His servant. For behold, from now on all generations will call me blessed;

verses.latin: Quia fecit mihi magna qui potens est: et sanctum nomen ejus.
verses.english: for He who is mighty has done great things for me, and holy is His name.

verses.latin: Et misericordia ejus a progenie in progenies timentibus eum.
verses.english: And His mercy is for those who fear Him from generation to generation.

verses.latin: Fecit potentiam in brachio suo: dispersit superbos mente cordis sui.
verses.english: He has shown strength with His arm; He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts,

verses.latin: Deposuit potentes de sede, et exaltavit humiles.
verses.english: He has brought down the mighty from their thrones and has exalted those of humble estate;

verses.latin: Esurientes implevit bonis: et divites dimisit inanes.
verses.english: He has filled the hungry with good things, and the rich He has sent away empty.

verses.latin: Suscepit Israël puerum suum, recordatus misericordiae suae.
verses.english: He has helped His servant Israel, in remembrance of His mercy,

verses.latin: Sicut locutus est ad patres nostros, Abraham et semini ejus in saecula.
verses.english: as He spoke to our fathers, to Abraham and to his offspring forever.”

verses.latin: Mansit autem Maria cum illa quasi mensibus tribus: et reversa est in domum suam.
verses.english: And Mary remained with her about three months and returned to her home.

verses.latin: Elisabeth autem impletum est tempus pariendi, et peperit filium.
verses.english: Now the time came for Elizabeth to give birth, and she bore a son.

verses.latin: Et audierunt vicini et cognati ejus quia magnificavit Dominus misericordiam suam cum illa, et congratulabantur ei.
verses.english: And her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown great mercy to her, and they rejoiced with her.

verses.latin: Et factum est, in die octavo, venerunt circumcidere puerum, et vocabant eum nomine patris ejus Zachariam.
verses.english: And on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they were going to call him by the name of his father Zechariah,

verses.latin: et respondens mater ejus, dixit: Non, sed vocabitur Joannes.
verses.english: and his mother answered, “No; he shall be called John.”

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ad illam: Quia non est quisquam in cognatione tua, qui vocetur hoc nomine.
verses.english: And they said to her, “But there is no one among your relatives who is called by this name.”

verses.latin: Innuebant autem patri ejus, quem vellet vocari eum.
verses.english: And they made signs to his father, inquiring what he wanted him to be called.

verses.latin: Et postulans pugillarem, scripsit, dicens: Joannes est nomen ejus. Et mirati sunt universi.
verses.english: And he asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” And they all marveled.

verses.latin: Apertum est autem illico os ejus, et lingua ejus soluta est: et loquebatur benedicens Deum.
verses.english: And immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue loosed, and he spoke, blessing God.

verses.latin: Et factus est timor super omnes vicinos eorum: et super omnia montana Judaeae divulgabantur omnia verba haec:
verses.english: And fear came upon all their neighbors, and all these things were talked about throughout all the hill country of Judea.

verses.latin: et omnes, qui audierant, posuerunt in corde suo, dicentes: Quis putas puer iste erit? Etenim manus Domini erat cum illo.
verses.english: And all who heard them laid them up in their hearts, saying, “What then will this child be?” For the hand of the Lord was with him.

verses.latin: Et Zacharias pater ejus repletus est Spiritu Sancto: et prophetavit dicens:
verses.english: And his father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying,

verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israël, quia visitavit, et fecit redemptionem plebis suae:
verses.english: “Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, for He has visited and redeemed His people

verses.latin: et erexit cornu salutis nobis in domo David pueri sui,
verses.english: and has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of His servant David,

verses.latin: sicut locutus est per os sanctorum, qui a saeculo sunt, prophetarum ejus:
verses.english: as He spoke by the mouth of His holy prophets from of old,

verses.latin: salutem ex inimicis nostris, et de manu omnium, qui oderunt nos:
verses.english: that we should be saved from our enemies and from the hand of all who hate us;

verses.latin: ad faciendam misericordiam cum patribus nostris: et memorari testamenti sui sancti:
verses.english: to show mercy to our fathers and to remember His holy covenant,

verses.latin: jusjurandum, quod juravit ad Abraham patrem nostrum, daturum se nobis,
verses.english: the oath that He swore to our father Abraham, to grant us

verses.latin: ut sine timore, de manu inimicorum nostrorum liberati, serviamus illi
verses.english: that we, being delivered from the hand of our enemies, might serve Him without fear,

verses.latin: in sanctitate et justitia coram ipso, omnibus diebus nostris.
verses.english: in holiness and righteousness before Him all our days.

verses.latin: Et tu puer, propheta Altissimi vocaberis: praeibis enim ante faciem Domini parare vias ejus:
verses.english: And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Most High; for you will go before the Lord to prepare His ways,

verses.latin: ad dandam scientiam salutis plebi ejus in remissionem peccatorum eorum:
verses.english: to give knowledge of salvation to His people in the forgiveness of their sins,

verses.latin: per viscera misericordiae Dei nostri: in quibus visitavit nos oriens ex alto:
verses.english: because of the tender mercy of our God, whereby the sunrise shall visit us from on high

verses.latin: illuminare his qui in tenebris et umbra mortis sedent: ad dirigendos pedes nostros in viam pacis.
verses.english: to give light to those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the way of peace.”

verses.latin: Puer autem crescebat, et confortabatur spiritu: et erat in desertis usque in diem ostensionis suae ad Israël.
verses.english: And the child grew and became strong in spirit, and he was in the wilderness until the day of his appearing to Israel.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in diebus illis, exiit edictum a Cæsare Augusto ut describeretur universus orbis.
verses.english: In those days, Caesar Augustus gave a decree for a census to be taken of the entire world.

verses.latin: Hæc descriptio prima facta est a præside Syriæ Cyrino.
verses.english: This first census took place when Quirinius was governor of Syria.

verses.latin: Et ibant omnes ut describerentur, singuli in propriam civitatem.
verses.english: And everyone went to be registered, each person to their own city.

verses.latin: Ascendit autem et Joseph a Galilæa de civitate Nazareth in Judæam, in civitatem David, quæ vocatur Bethlehem: eo quod esset de domo et familia David,
verses.english: So Joseph went up from the town of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to the city of David, called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and lineage of David,

verses.latin: ut describeretur cum Maria sponsa sua uxore, prægnante.
verses.english: to be registered with Mary, his espoused wife, who was pregnant.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum essent ibi, impleti sunt dies ut pareret.
verses.english: And it came to pass that, while they were there, the days were fulfilled for her to give birth.

verses.latin: Et peperit filium suum primogenitum: et pannis eum involvit, et reclinavit eum in præsepio: quia non erat eis locus in diversorio.
verses.english: She brought forth her firstborn Son, wrapped Him in swaddling clothes, and laid Him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn.

verses.latin: Et pastores erant in regione eadem vigilantes, et custodientes vigilias noctis supra gregem suum.
verses.english: And there were shepherds in the same region, keeping watch and guarding the night over their flock.

verses.latin: Et ecce angelus Domini stetit juxta illos, et claritas Dei circumfulsit illos: et timuerunt timore magno.
verses.english: And behold, an angel of the Lord stood next to them, and the glory of God shone round about them, and they were greatly afraid.

verses.latin: Et dixit illis angelus: Nolite timere: ecce enim evangelizo vobis gaudium magnum, quod erit omni populo:
verses.english: Then the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy that will be for all the people:

verses.latin: quia natus est vobis hodie Salvator, qui est Christus Dominus, in civitate David.
verses.english: For to you is born this day in the city of David a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.

verses.latin: Et hoc vobis signum: invenietis infantem pannis involutum, et positum in præsepio.
verses.english: And this is a sign for you: you will find a baby wrapped in swaddling clothes and lying in a manger.”

verses.latin: Et subito factus est cum angelo multitudo militiæ cælestis laudantium Deum, et dicentium:
verses.english: And suddenly there appeared with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God and saying:

verses.latin: Gloria in altissimis Deo, et in terra pax hominibus bonæ voluntatis.
verses.english: “Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace to those He favors.”

verses.latin: Et factum est, ut discesserunt ab eis angeli in cælum: pastores loquebantur ad invicem: Transeamus usque Bethlehem, et videamus hoc verbum quod factum est, quod Dominus ostendit nobis.
verses.english: And it came to pass, when the angels went away from them into the sky, that the shepherds said to one another, “Let us go over to Bethlehem and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has made known to us.”

verses.latin: Et venerunt festinantes: et invenerunt Mariam et Joseph, et infantem positum in præsepio.
verses.english: And they went with haste and found Mary and Joseph, and the baby lying in a manger.

verses.latin: Videntes autem cognoverunt de verbo quod dictum est illis de puero hoc.
verses.english: When they had seen, they made known the saying which was told them concerning this Child.

verses.latin: Et omnes qui audierunt, mirati sunt de his quæ dicta erant a pastoribus ad ipsos.
verses.english: And all who heard it were amazed at what the shepherds told them.

verses.latin: Maria autem conservabat omnia verba hæc, conferens in corde suo.
verses.english: But Mary kept all these things, pondering them in her heart.

verses.latin: Et reversi sunt pastores glorificantes et laudantes Deum pro omnibus quæ audierant et viderant, sicut dictum est ad illos.
verses.english: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all they had heard and seen, as it was told them.

verses.latin: Et postquam consummati sunt dies octo, ut circumcideretur puer, vocatum est nomen ejus Jesus, quod vocatum est ab angelo priusquam in utero conciperetur.
verses.english: And when eight days were fulfilled for circumcising the Child, His name was called Jesus, the name given by the angel before He was conceived in the womb.

verses.latin: Et postquam impleti sunt dies purgationis ejus secundum legem Moysi, duxerunt illum in Ierusalem, ut sisterent eum Domino,
verses.english: And when the days of her purification according to the Law of Moses were fulfilled, they brought Him to Jerusalem to present Him to the Lord,

verses.latin: (sicut scriptum est in lege Domini: Quia omne masculinum quod aperit vulvam, sanctum Domino vocabitur:)
verses.english: (as it is written in the Law of the Lord, “Every male who opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord,”)

verses.latin: et ut darent sacrificium secundum quod dictum est in lege Domini, par turturum, aut duos pullos columbarum.
verses.english: and to offer a sacrifice according to what is said in the Law of the Lord, “a pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons.”

verses.latin: Et ecce homo erat in Ierusalem, cui nomen Simeon: et homo iste justus et timoratus, expectans consolationem Israël: et Spiritus Sanctus erat in eo.
verses.english: And behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon, and this man was righteous and devout, looking for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.

verses.latin: Et erat responsum accipi ab Spiritu Sancto, non moriturum se, nisi videret Christum Domini.
verses.english: And it had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.

verses.latin: Et venit in spiritu in templum. Et cum inducerent puerum Jesum parentes ejus, ut facerent pro eo secundum consuetudinem legis,
verses.english: And he came in the Spirit into the temple. And when the parents brought in the Child Jesus to do for Him according to the custom of the Law,

verses.latin: ipse suscepit eum in ulnas suas: et benedixit Deum, et dixit:
verses.english: he took Him up in his arms and blessed God and said:

verses.latin: Nunc dimittis servum tuum, Domine, secundum verbum tuum in pace:
verses.english: “Now, Lord, You are letting Your servant depart in peace, according to Your word;

verses.latin: Quia viderunt oculi mei salutare tuum:
verses.english: For my eyes have seen Your salvation

verses.latin: Quod parasti ante faciem omnium populorum:
verses.english: Which You have prepared before the face of all peoples,

verses.latin: Lumen ad revelationem gentium, et gloriam plebis tuæ Israël.
verses.english: A light for revelation to the Gentiles, and the glory of Your people Israel.”

verses.latin: Et erat pater ejus et mater mirantes super his quæ dicebantur de illo.
verses.english: And his father and mother were marveling at the things spoken concerning Him.

verses.latin: Et benedixit illis Simeon, et dixit ad Mariam matrem ejus: Ecce positus est hic in ruinam et in resurrectionem multorum in Israël, et in signum cui contradicetur.
verses.english: And Simeon blessed them and said to Mary His mother, “Behold, this Child is destined for the fall and rising of many in Israel, and for a sign which will be spoken against

verses.latin: Et tuam ipsius animam pertransibit gladius: ut revelentur ex multis cordibus cogitationes.
verses.english: and a sword will pierce through your own soul also, that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.”

verses.latin: Et erat Anna, prophetissa, filia Phanuhel, de tribu Aser: hæc profecerat in diebus multis, et vixerat cum viro suo annis septem a virginitate sua.
verses.english: And there was a prophetess, Anna, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was advanced in years, having lived with her husband seven years from her virginity,

verses.latin: Et hæc vidua usque ad annos octoginta quatuor: quæ non discedebat de templo, jejuniis et obsecrationibus deserviens nocte ac die.
verses.english: and then as a widow until she was eighty-four years old. She did not depart from the temple, serving God with fastings and prayers night and day.

verses.latin: Hæc ipsa hora superveniens, confitebatur Domino: et loquebatur de illo omnibus qui expectabant redemptionem Israël.
verses.english: And coming up at that very hour, she gave thanks to God and spoke of Him to all those who were looking for the redemption of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et ut perfecerunt omnia secundum legem Domini, reversi sunt in Galilæam, in civitatem suam Nazareth.
verses.english: And when they had performed everything according to the Law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own city of Nazareth.

verses.latin: Puer autem crescebat, et confortabatur, plenus sapientia: et gratia Dei erat in illo.
verses.english: And the Child continued to grow and become strong, filled with wisdom, and the favor of God was upon Him.

verses.latin: Et ibant parentes ejus per omnes annos in Ierusalem, in die festo Paschæ.
verses.english: Now His parents went to Jerusalem every year at the Feast of the Passover.

verses.latin: Et cum factus esset annorum duodecim, ascendentibus illis in Ierusalem secundum consuetudinem diei festi,
verses.english: And when He was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the Feast,

verses.latin: et consummatis diebus, cum redirent, remansit puer Jesus in Ierusalem, et non cognoverunt parentes ejus.
verses.english: and as they were returning, after spending the full number of days, the boy Jesus remained in Jerusalem, but His parents did not know it.

verses.latin: Existimantes autem illum esse in comitatu, venerunt iter diei: et quærebant eum inter propinquos et notos.
verses.english: Assuming Him to be in the caravan, they went a day’s journey, and they began looking for Him among their relatives and acquaintances.

verses.latin: Et non invenientes, regressi sunt in Ierusalem, quærentes eum.
verses.english: When they did not find Him, they returned to Jerusalem, looking for Him.

verses.latin: Et factum est, post triduum, invenerunt eum in templo, sedentem in medio doctorum, audientem illos, et interrogantem eos.
verses.english: After three days they found Him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, both listening to them and asking them questions.

verses.latin: Stupebant autem omnes qui eum audiebant, super prudentia et responsis ejus.
verses.english: And all who heard Him were amazed at His understanding and His answers.

verses.latin: Et videntes admirati sunt. Et dixit ad illum mater ejus: Fili, quid fecisti nobis sic? Ecce pater tuus et ego dolentes quærebamus te.
verses.english: When they saw Him, they were astonished; and His mother said to Him, “Son, why have You treated us like this? Behold, Your father and I have been anxiously looking for You.”

verses.latin: Et dixit ad illos: Quid est quod me quærebatis? Nesciebatis quia in his quæ Patris mei sunt, oportet me esse?
verses.english: And He said to them, “Why were you looking for Me? Did you not know that I must be about My Father’s business?”

verses.latin: Et ipsi non intellexerunt verbum quod locutus est ad illos.
verses.english: But they did not understand the statement which He spoke to them.

verses.latin: Et descendit cum eis, et venit Nazareth: et erat subditus illis. Et mater ejus conservabat omnia verba hæc in corde suo.
verses.english: And He went down with them and came to Nazareth, and was subject to them, and His mother kept all these things in her heart.

verses.latin: Et Jesus proficiebat sapientia, et ætate, et gratia apud Deum et hominibus.
verses.english: And Jesus kept increasing in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men.

verses.latin: Anno quintodecimo imperii Tiberii Caesaris, procurante Pontio Pilato Judaeam, et tetrarcha Galilaeae Herode, fratre ejus Philippo tetrarcha Ituraeae et Trachonitidis regionis, et Lysania tetrarcha Abilinae,
verses.english: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, when Pontius Pilate was governing Judea, Herod was tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip was tetrarch of Ituraea and the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias was tetrarch of Abilene,

verses.latin: sub principibus sacerdotum Anna et Caipha, factum est verbum Domini super Ioannem, filium Zachariae, in deserto.
verses.english: during the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of the Lord came to John, the son of Zechariah, in the desert.

verses.latin: Et venit in omnem regionem Jordanis praedicans baptismum paenitentiae in remissionem peccatorum,
verses.english: And he went into all the country around the Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.

verses.latin: sicut scriptum est in libro sermonum Isaiae prophetae: Vox clamantis in deserto: Parate viam Domini, rectas facite semitas ejus:
verses.english: As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet: "The voice of one crying in the desert: 'Prepare the way of the Lord, make straight his paths.'

verses.latin: Omnis vallis implebitur, et omnis mons et collis humiliabitur: et erunt prava in directa, et viae asperae in vias planas:
verses.english: 'Every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill shall be brought low: and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough ways shall be made smooth.'

verses.latin: et videbit omnis caro salutare Dei.
verses.english: 'And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.'

verses.latin: Dicebat ergo turbis, quae exiebant baptizari ab eo: Progenies viperarum, quis demonstravit vobis fugere a ventura ira?
verses.english: He therefore said to the crowds that went out to be baptized by him: "Offspring of vipers, who has shown you how to flee from the wrath to come?

verses.latin: Facite ergo fructus dignos paenitentiae: et ne coeperitis dicere: Patrem habemus Abraham. Dico enim vobis quia potest Deus de lapidibus istis suscitare filios Abrahae.
verses.english: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance; and do not begin to say, 'We have Abraham for our father.' For I tell you that God is able, even from these stones, to raise up children to Abraham.

verses.latin: Jam enim securis ad radicem arborum posita est. Omnis ergo arbor, quae non facit fructum bonum, excidetur, et in ignem mittetur.
verses.english: For now the axe is laid to the root of the trees. Every tree therefore that does not produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.

verses.latin: Et interrogabant eum turbae, dicentes: Quid ergo faciemus?
verses.english: And the crowds were questioning him, saying: "What then should we do?

verses.latin: Respondens autem dicebat eis: Qui habet duas tunicas, det non habenti: et qui habet escas, similiter faciat.
verses.english: And he answering, said to them: "He that has two coats, let him give to him that has none; and he that has food, let him do in like manner.

verses.latin: Venere autem et publicani baptizari: et dixerunt ad illum: Magister, quid faciemus?
verses.english: And the publicans also came to be baptized; and they said to him: "Master, what shall we do?

verses.latin: At ille dixit ad eos: Nihil amplius quam quod constitutum est vobis faciatis.
verses.english: But he said to them: "Do nothing more than that which is appointed to you.

verses.latin: Interrogabant autem eum et milites, dicentes: Et nos, quid faciemus? Et dixit eis: Neminem concutiatis, neque calumniam faciatis: et sufficiat vobis stipendium vestrum.
verses.english: And the soldiers also questioned him, saying: "And we, what shall we do?" And he said to them: "Do violence to no one, nor accuse anyone falsely; and be content with your pay.

verses.latin: Existimante autem populo, et cogitante omnibus in cordibus suis de Ioanne, si forte ipse esset Christus,
verses.english: Now as the people were in expectation, and all were thinking in their hearts of John, if perhaps he were Christ,

verses.latin: respondens Ioannes omnibus, dixit: Ego quidem aqua baptizo vos: sed venit fortior me, cujus non sum dignus solvere corrigiam calceamentorum ejus: ipse vos baptizabit in Spiritu Sancto, et igne:
verses.english: John, answering, said to them all: "I indeed baptize you with water; but there shall come one mightier than I, the strap of whose shoes I am not worthy to loose: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire.

verses.latin: cujus ventilabrum in manu ejus: et purgabit aream suam, et congregabit triticum in horreum suum, paleas autem comburet igni inextinguibili.
verses.english: Whose fan is in his hand, and he will purge his floor, and will gather the wheat into his granary; but the chaff he will burn with unquenchable fire.

verses.latin: Multa quidem alia exhortans evangelizabat populum.
verses.english: And many other things, exhorting, he preached to the people.

verses.latin: Herodes autem tetrarcha, cum argueretur ab eo de Herodiade uxore fratris sui, et de omnibus malis quae fecit Herodes,
verses.english: But Herod the tetrarch, when he was reproved by him for Herodias his brother's wife, and for all the evils that Herod had done,

verses.latin: adjecit et hoc supra omnia, et clausit Ioannem in carcere.
verses.english: added this also above all, and shut up John in prison.

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum baptizaretur omnis populus, et Jesu baptizato, et orante, apertum est caelum,
verses.english: Now it came to pass, when all the people were baptized, that Jesus also being baptized and praying, heaven was opened;

verses.latin: et Spiritus Sanctus corporali specie, sicut columba, descendit super ipsum: et vox de caelo facta est: Tu es filius meus dilectus: in te mihi complacui.
verses.english: And the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape, as a dove upon him; and a voice came from heaven: "Thou art my beloved Son; in thee I am well pleased.

verses.latin: Et ipse Jesus erat incipiens quasi annorum triginta, filius putabatur Joseph, qui fuit Heli,
verses.english: And Jesus himself was beginning about thirty years old, being (as was supposed) the son of Joseph, who was of Heli,

verses.latin: qui fuit Matthath, qui fuit Levi, qui fuit Melchi, qui fuit Janna, qui fuit Joseph,
verses.english: who was of Matthath, who was of Levi, who was of Melchi, who was of Janna, who was of Joseph,

verses.latin: qui fuit Mattathiae, qui fuit Amos, qui fuit Naum, qui fuit Esli, qui fuit Naggae,
verses.english: who was of Mattathias, who was of Amos, who was of Nahum, who was of Esli, who was of Naggae,

verses.latin: qui fuit Maath, qui fuit Matthathiae, qui fuit Semei, qui fuit Josech, qui fuit Joda,
verses.english: who was of Maath, who was of Mattathias, who was of Semei, who was of Josech, who was of Joda,

verses.latin: qui fuit Joannan, qui fuit Rhesa, qui fuit Zorobabel, qui fuit Salaathiel, qui fuit Neri,
verses.english: who was of Joannan, who was of Rhesa, who was of Zorobabel, who was of Salaathiel, who was of Neri,

verses.latin: qui fuit Melchi, qui fuit Addi, qui fuit Chosam, qui fuit Elmodam, qui fuit Her,
verses.english: who was of Melchi, who was of Addi, who was of Chosam, who was of Elmodam, who was of Her,

verses.latin: qui fuit Jose, qui fuit Eliezer, qui fuit Jorim, qui fuit Matthath, qui fuit Levi,
verses.english: who was of Jose, who was of Eliezer, who was of Jorim, who was of Matthath, who was of Levi,

verses.latin: qui fuit Simeon, qui fuit Juda, qui fuit Joseph, qui fuit Jona, qui fuit Eliachim,
verses.english: who was of Simeon, who was of Juda, who was of Joseph, who was of Jona, who was of Eliachim,

verses.latin: qui fuit Melea, qui fuit Menna, qui fuit Matthata, qui fuit Nathan, qui fuit David,
verses.english: who was of Melea, who was of Menna, who was of Matthata, who was of Nathan, who was of David,

verses.latin: qui fuit Isai, qui fuit Obed, qui fuit Booz, qui fuit Sela, qui fuit Aram,
verses.english: who was of Isai, who was of Obed, who was of Booz, who was of Sela, who was of Aram,

verses.latin: qui fuit Aminadab, qui fuit Admin, qui fuit Arni, qui fuit Esrom, qui fuit Phares, qui fuit Juda,
verses.english: who was of Aminadab, who was of Admin, who was of Arni, who was of Esrom, who was of Phares, who was of Juda,

verses.latin: qui fuit Jacob, qui fuit Isaac, qui fuit Abraham, qui fuit Thare, qui fuit Nachor,
verses.english: who was of Jacob, who was of Isaac, who was of Abraham, who was of Thare, who was of Nachor,

verses.latin: qui fuit Seruch, qui fuit Ragau, qui fuit Phalec, qui fuit Heber, qui fuit Sale,
verses.english: who was of Seruch, who was of Ragau, who was of Phalec, who was of Heber, who was of Sale,

verses.latin: qui fuit Cainan, qui fuit Arphaxad, qui fuit Sem, qui fuit Noe, qui fuit Lamech,
verses.english: who was of Cainan, who was of Arphaxad, who was of Sem, who was of Noe, who was of Lamech,

verses.latin: qui fuit Matusala, qui fuit Enoch, qui fuit Jared, qui fuit Malaleel, qui fuit Cainan,
verses.english: who was of Matusala, who was of Enoch, who was of Jared, who was of Malaleel, who was of Cainan,

verses.latin: qui fuit Enos, qui fuit Seth, qui fuit Adam, qui fuit Dei.
verses.english: who was of Enos, who was of Seth, who was of Adam, who was of God.

verses.latin: Spiritu Sancto plenus, regressus est Iesus a Iordane, et agebatur a Spiritu in desertum
verses.english: Filled with the Holy Spirit, Jesus returned from the Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the desert.

verses.latin: ubi quadraginta diebus tentabatur a Diabolo. Et nihil manducavit in diebus illis: et consummatis illis, esuriit.
verses.english: There, He was tested by the Devil for forty days. And during those days, He ate nothing. When those days were over, He was hungry.

verses.latin: Dixit autem illi Diabolus: Si Filius Dei es, dic lapidi huic ut panis fiat.
verses.english: The Devil said to Him, "If you are the Son of God, tell this stone to become bread."

verses.latin: Et respondit ad illum Iesus: Scriptum est: Non in solo pane vivit homo, sed in omni verbo Dei.
verses.english: Jesus answered him, "It is written: ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.’"

verses.latin: Et duxit illum diabolus in montem altum, et ostendit illi omnia regna orbis terrae in momento temporis,
verses.english: Then the Devil led Him up and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world in an instant.

verses.latin: et dixit illi diabolus: Tibi dabo potestatem hanc universam et gloriam illorum: quia mihi tradita sunt, et cui volo, do illa.
verses.english: And the Devil said to Him, "To you I will give all this power and their glory, because it has been given to me, and I give it to whomever I wish."

verses.latin: Igitur si adoraveris coram me, erunt tua omnia.
verses.english: If you worship me, then all shall be yours."

verses.latin: Et respondens Iesus, dixit illi: Scriptum est: Dominum Deum tuum adorabis, et illi soli servies.
verses.english: Jesus answered him, "It is written: ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and Him only shall you serve.’"

verses.latin: Et duxit illum in Ierusalem, et statuit eum supra pinnam templi, et dixit illi: Si Filius Dei es, mitte te hinc deorsum;
verses.english: Then he brought Him to Jerusalem and placed Him on the highest part of the Temple, and said to Him, "If you are the Son of God, throw Yourself down from here;

verses.latin: scriptum est enim quod angelis suis mandavit de te, ut conservent te:
verses.english: for it is written, ‘He will command His angels concerning you, to guard you;’

verses.latin: et quia in manibus portabunt te, ne forte offendas ad lapidem pedem tuum.
verses.english: and ‘On their hands they will bear you up, lest at any time you dash your foot against a stone.’"

verses.latin: Et respondens Iesus, dixit illi: Dictum est: Non tentabis Dominum Deum tuum.
verses.english: And Jesus answering, said to him, "It is said: ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’"

verses.latin: Et consummata omni tentatione, diabolus recessit ab illo usque ad tempus.
verses.english: When the Devil had finished every temptation, he departed from Him for a time.

verses.latin: Et regressus est Iesus in virtute spiritus in Galilaeam: et fama exiit per universam regionem circa.
verses.english: Then Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee, and news about Him went out through all the surrounding region.

verses.latin: Et ipse docebat in synagogis eorum, et glorificabatur ab omnibus.
verses.english: And He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all.

verses.latin: Et venit Nazareth, ubi erat nutritus: et intravit secundum consuetudinem suam die sabbati in synagogam, et surrexit legere.
verses.english: He came to Nazareth, where He had been brought up. And, as was His custom, He went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day and stood up to read.

verses.latin: Et traditus est illi liber Isaiae prophetae. Et cum aperuisset librum, invenit locum ubi scriptum erat:
verses.english: And the book of the prophet Isaiah was handed to Him. When He had opened the book, He found the place where it was written:

verses.latin: Spiritus Domini super me: propter quod unxit me: evangelizare pauperibus misit me, sanare contritos corde, praedicare captivis remissionem, et caecis visum, dimittere confractos in remissionem,
verses.english: “The Spirit of the Lord is upon Me, because He has anointed Me to preach the Gospel to the poor; He has sent Me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives, and recovery of sight to the blind, to set at liberty those who are oppressed,

verses.latin: et praedicare annum Domini acceptum.
verses.english: to preach the acceptable year of the Lord."

verses.latin: Et cum plicuisset librum, reddit ministro, et sedit. Et omnium in synagoga oculi erant intendentes in eum.
verses.english: Then He closed the book, and gave it back to the attendant and sat down. The eyes of all those in the synagogue were fixed on Him.

verses.latin: Cœpit autem dicere ad illos: Quia hodie impleta est haec scriptura in auribus vestris.
verses.english: And He began to say to them, “Today this Scripture is fulfilled in your hearing.”

verses.latin: Et omnes testimonium illi dabant: et mirabantur in verbis gratiæ, quae procedebant de ore illius, et dicebant: Nonne hic est filius Joseph?
verses.english: And all bore witness to Him and marveled at the gracious words that proceeded out of His mouth. And they said, “Is this not the son of Joseph?”

verses.latin: Et ait ad illos: Utique dicetis mihi hanc similitudinem: Medice, cura teipsum: quanta audivimus facta in Capharnaum, fac et hic in patria tua.
verses.english: And He said to them, "You will surely quote this proverb to Me: ‘Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in Your country.’"

verses.latin: Ait autem: Amen dico vobis, quia nemo propheta acceptus est in patria sua.
verses.english: And He said, "Truly I say to you, no prophet is accepted in his own country.

verses.latin: Vere autem dico vobis, multae viduae erant in diebus Eliae in Israël, quando clausus est caelum per annos tres et menses sex, cum facta esset fames magna in universa terra:
verses.english: But I tell you truly, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the sky was shut up for three years and six months, and when great famine was throughout all the land;

verses.latin: et ad neminem illorum missus est Elias, nisi in Sarepta Sidoniae, ad mulierem viduam.
verses.english: and Elijah was sent to none of them except to Zarephath, in the land of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.

verses.latin: Et multi leprosi erant in Israël in tempore Elisei prophetae: et nemo eorum mundatus est, nisi Naaman Syrus.
verses.english: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, and none of them were cleansed except Naaman the Syrian."

verses.latin: Et repleti sunt omnes in synagoga ira, haec audientes.
verses.english: And all those in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath.

verses.latin: Et surrexerunt, et eiecerunt eum extra civitatem: et ad supercilium montis, super quem civitas illorum erat ædificata, ut deorsum praecipitarent eum.
verses.english: Then they rose up and thrust Him out of the city, and led Him to the brow of the hill on which their city was built, that they might throw Him down headlong.

verses.latin: Ipse autem transiens per medium illorum, abiit.
verses.english: But He, passing through their midst, went His way.

verses.latin: Et descendit in Capharnaum civitatem Galilaeae, et erat illos docens sabbatis.
verses.english: Then He went down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and was teaching them on the Sabbath.

verses.latin: Et *stupebant* super doctrina ejus: quia in potestate erat sermo ipsius.
verses.english: And they were astonished at His teaching, for His word was with authority.

verses.latin: Et in synagoga erat homo habens spiritum daemonis immundi, et exclamavit voce magna,
verses.english: Now in the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,

verses.latin: dicens: Eia, quid nobis et tibi, Iesu Nazarene? venisti perdere nos? scio te qui sis, Sanctus Dei.
verses.english: saying, “Let us alone! What have we to do with You, Jesus of Nazareth? Have You come to destroy us? I know You, who You are—the Holy One of God!”

verses.latin: Et increpavit illum Iesus, dicens: Obmutesce, et exi ab eo. Et cum *iecisset* illum daemonium in medium, exiit ab eo nihil nocens ei.
verses.english: But Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!” And when the demon had thrown him down in their midst, it came out of him, without hurting him.

verses.latin: Et factus est stupor in omnibus, et conloquebantur ad invicem, dicentes: Quid est hoc verbum? quia in potestate et virtute imperat immundis spiritibus, et exeunt.
verses.english: Then they were all amazed, and they spoke among themselves, saying, “What is this word? For with authority and power He commands the unclean spirits, and they come out.”

verses.latin: Et exibat fama de illo in omnem locum regionis circa.
verses.english: And the report about Him went out into every place in the surrounding region.

verses.latin: Surgens autem de synagoga, intravit in domum Simonis. Socrus autem Simonis tenebatur magnis febribus: et rogaverunt illum pro ea.
verses.english: Then He arose from the synagogue and entered Simon’s house. Now Simon’s wife’s mother was ill with a high fever, and they made request of Him concerning her.

verses.latin: Et stans super illam, imperavit febri, et dimisit eam. Et continuo surgens, ministrabat illis.
verses.english: So He stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. And immediately she arose and served them.

verses.latin: Cum sol occidisset, omnes quotquot habebant infirmos variis languoribus, duxerunt illos ad eum. At ipse singulis manus imponens, curabat eos.
verses.english: When the sun was setting, all those who had any that were sick with various diseases brought them to Him. And He laid His hands on every one of them and healed them.

verses.latin: Exiebant autem daemoniain a multis, clamantes et dicentes: Quia tu es Filius Dei. Et increpans, non sinebat eos loqui: quia sciebant quod esset Christus.
verses.english: And demons also came out of many, crying out and saying, “You are the Son of God!” And rebuking them, He did not allow them to speak, because they knew that He was the Christ.

verses.latin: Facta autem die, egressus ibat in desertum locum, et turbæ requirebant eum, et venerunt usque ad ipsum: et detinebant eum ne discederet ab eis.
verses.english: Now when day came, He departed and went into a desolate place. And the crowds were looking for Him, and came to Him, and tried to keep Him from going away from them;

verses.latin: Quibus ille ait: Quia et aliis civitatibus oportet me evangelizare regnum Dei: quia ideo missus sum.
verses.english: but He said to them, “I must preach the kingdom of God to the other cities also, because for this reason I have been sent."

verses.latin: Et erat praedicans in synagogis Galilaeae.
verses.english: And He was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum turba irruente circumiret eum, audire verbum Dei, et ipse stabat secus lacum Genesareth,
verses.english: It came to pass that when the crowds pressed in on Him, wanting to hear the Word of God, He was standing by the lake of Gennesaret.

verses.latin: et vidit duas naves stantes secus lacum: nautae autem egressi a se, lavabant retia.
verses.english: He saw two boats standing by the lake, but the fishermen had left them and were washing their nets.

verses.latin: Ascendens autem in unam navium, quae erat Simonis, rogavit eum ut reduceret navem pusillum a terra. Et sedens docebat turbas de navi.
verses.english: And He, entering into one of the boats, which was Simon's, asked him to move the boat a little from the land. And, sitting down, He taught the crowds from the boat.

verses.latin: Ut cessavit autem loqui, dixit ad Simonem: Duc in altum, et laxate retia vestra in capturam.
verses.english: When He had finished speaking, He said to Simon, “Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a catch.”

verses.latin: Et respondens Simon, dixit illi: Præceptor, per totam noctem laborantes, nihil cepimus: sed in verbo tuo laxabo rete.
verses.english: And Simon answering, said to Him: “Master, we have toiled all night and taken nothing; but at your word, I will let down the net.”

verses.latin: Et cum hoc fecissent, concluserunt piscium multitudinem copiosam: et rumpebantur retia eorum.
verses.english: And when they had done this, they enclosed a great multitude of fish, and their nets were breaking.

verses.latin: Et annuerunt sociis, qui erant in altera navi, ut venirent et adjuvarent eos. Et venerunt, et impleverunt ambas naves, ita ut pene mergerentur.
verses.english: And they beckoned to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both boats, so that they were almost sinking.

verses.latin: Quod cum vidisset Simon Petrus, procidit ad genua Jesu, dicens: Exi a me, quia homo peccator sum, Domine.
verses.english: Which when Simon Peter saw, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying: “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, O Lord.”

verses.latin: Stupor enim circumdederat illum, et omnes qui cum illo erant, in captura piscium quam ceperant:
verses.english: For he was astonished, and all who were with him, at the catch of the fish that they had taken.

verses.latin: similiter autem et Jacobum, et Joannem filios Zebedæi, qui erant socii Simonis. Et dixit ad Simonem Jesus: Noli timere: ex hoc jam homines eris capiens.
verses.english: And so also James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were Simon's partners. And Jesus said to Simon, “Do not fear; from now on you will be catching men.”

verses.latin: Et cum reduxissent naves ad terram, relictis omnibus, secuti sunt eum.
verses.english: And when they had brought the boats to land, they left everything and followed Him.

verses.latin: Et factum est cum esset in una civitatum, ecce vir plenus lepra: et videns Jesum, procidens, deprecatus est eum, dicens: Domine, si vis, potes me mundare.
verses.english: And it came to pass that when He was in one of the cities, behold, a man full of leprosy; and seeing Jesus, he fell on his face and besought Him, saying: “Lord, if You will, You can make me clean.”

verses.latin: Et extendens manum, tetigit eum, dicens: Volo: mundare. Et continuo lepra discessit ab eo.
verses.english: And extending His hand, He touched him, saying: “I will; be clean.” And immediately the leprosy left him.

verses.latin: Et ipse præcepit illi, ut nemini diceret: sed vade, ostende te sacerdoti, et offer pro mundatione tua, sicut præcepit Moyses, in testimonium illis.
verses.english: And He charged him to tell no one, but “Go, show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing as Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”

verses.latin: Et famam de eo, adhuc magis peribatur: et concurrebant turbae multae, audientes, et curantes infirmitates suas.
verses.english: But so much the more the report about Him spread, and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed of their infirmities.

verses.latin: Ipse autem secedebat in desertis locis, et orabat.
verses.english: But He was withdrawing to the deserts and praying.

verses.latin: Et factum est in una dierum, ut sedebat ille docens: et erant pharisæi, et legis doctores sedentes, qui venerant ex omni castello Galilææ, et Judææ, et Jerosolymis: et virtus Domini erat ad sanandum illos.
verses.english: And it came to pass on one of those days, that He was teaching, and there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, who had come out of every town of Galilee and Judea and Jerusalem; and the power of the Lord was present to heal them.

verses.latin: Et ecce viri portantes in lecto hominem, qui erat paralyticus: et quærebant inferre eum, et ponere ante eum.
verses.english: And behold, men were carrying a man on a bed who was paralyzed; and they were seeking to bring him in and to set him before Him.

verses.latin: Et non invenientes qua parte illum inferrent præ turba, ascenderunt supra tectum, et per tegulas demiserunt eum cum lectulo in medium ante Jesum.
verses.english: And not finding by what way they might bring him in because of the crowd, they went upon the housetop, and let him down with the bed through the tiles into the midst before Jesus.

verses.latin: Quorum fidem cum vidisset, dixit: Homo, remittuntur tibi peccata tua.
verses.english: When He saw their faith, He said: “Man, your sins are forgiven you.”

verses.latin: Et cœperunt cogitare scribæ et pharisæi, dicentes: Quis est hic, qui loquitur blasphemias? Quis potest dimittere peccata, nisi solus Deus?
verses.english: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to question, saying: “Who is this that speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?”

verses.latin: Jesus autem, cum cognovisset cogitationes eorum, respondens, dixit ad illos: Quid cogitatis in cordibus vestris?
verses.english: But Jesus, knowing their thoughts, answering, said to them: “What do you question in your hearts?

verses.latin: Quid est facilius, dicere: Dimittuntur tibi peccata tua; an dicere: Surge, et ambula?
verses.english: Which is easier, to say: ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say: ‘Rise and walk’?

verses.latin: Ut autem sciatis, quia Filius hominis potestatem habet in terra dimittendi peccata (ait paralytico): Tibi dico, surge, tolle lectum tuum, et vade in domum tuam.
verses.english: But that you may know that the Son of Man has the power on earth to forgive sins, He said to the paralytic: “I say to you, arise, take up your bed, and go to your house.”

verses.latin: Et confestim surgens coram illis, et tollens in quo jacebat, abiit in domum suam, magnifìcans Deum.
verses.english: And immediately rising up before them, and taking up the bed on which he was lying, he went to his own house, glorifying God.

verses.latin: Et stupor apprehendit omnes, et glorificabant Deum: et impleti sunt timore, dicentes: Quia vidimus hodie mirabilia.
verses.english: And amazement took hold of all, and they glorified God; and they were filled with fear, saying: “We have seen wonderful things today.”

verses.latin: Et post hæc exiit, et vidit publicanum, nomine Levi, sedentem ad teloneum, et ait illi: Sequere me.
verses.english: And after these things, He went out and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax office, and He said to him: “Follow Me.”

verses.latin: Et relicto omnibus, surgens secutus est eum.
verses.english: And leaving everything, he arose and followed Him.

verses.latin: Et fecit ei convivium magnum Levi in domo sua: et erat turba multa publicanorum, et aliorum, qui cum illis erant discumbentes.
verses.english: And Levi made Him a great feast in his own house; and there was a large crowd of tax collectors and others who were reclining with them.

verses.latin: Et murmurabant pharisæi et scribæ eorum, ad discipulos ejus, dicentes: Quare cum publicanis et peccatoribus manducatis et bibitis?
verses.english: And the Pharisees and their scribes murmured against His disciples, saying: “Why do you eat and drink with the tax collectors and sinners?”

verses.latin: Et respondens Jesus, dixit ad illos: Non egent medici sani, sed qui male habent.
verses.english: And Jesus answering, said to them: “Those who are well do not need a physician, but those who are sick.”

verses.latin: Non veni vocare justos, sed peccatores ad pœnitentiam.
verses.english: “I have not come to call the just, but sinners to repentance.”

verses.latin: Dicebant autem ad eum: Discipuli Joannis, sæpe jejunant, et obsecrationes faciunt: similiter et pharisæorum: tui autem manducant et bibunt.
verses.english: And they said to Him: “The disciples of John fast often and make supplications; likewise, the Pharisees do; but Yours eat and drink.”

verses.latin: Quibus Jesus ait: Non potestis filios sponsi, quamdiu cum illis est sponsus, facere jejunare.
verses.english: To whom Jesus said: “Can you make the sons of the bridegroom fast while the bridegroom is with them?

verses.latin: Venient autem dies cum auferetur ab illis sponsus: tunc jejunabunt in illis diebus.
verses.english: “But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them; then they will fast in those days.”

verses.latin: Dicebat autem et similitudinem eis: Quia nemo mittit pannum de veste nova, in vestimentum vetus: alioquin et novum rumpit, et veteri non convenit additio, quæ de novo est.
verses.english: He spoke also a parable to them: “No one puts a piece from a new garment onto an old garment; otherwise, the new will tear, and the piece from the new will not match the old.”

verses.latin: Et nemo mittit vinum novum in utres veteres: alioquin rumpet vinum novum utres, et ipsum effundetur, et utres peribunt.
verses.english: “And no one puts new wine into old wineskins; otherwise, the new wine will burst the wineskins, and it will be spilled, and the wineskins will be ruined.

verses.latin: Sed novum vinum in utres novos mittendum est: et ambo conservantur.
verses.english: “But new wine must be put into fresh wineskins; then both are preserved.”

verses.latin: Et nemo bibens vetus, statim vult novum: dicit enim: Vetus melius est.
verses.english: And no one, drinking the old, wants the new immediately; for he says, ‘The old is better.’”

verses.latin: Factum est autem in sabbato secundo primo, cum transiret per sata, vellentes discipuli ejus spicas, et manducabant, confricantes manibus.
verses.english: One Sabbath day, Jesus went out through a field of grain. His disciples began to pluck some heads of grain, rubbing them in their hands.

verses.latin: Quidam autem pharisaeorum, dicunt illis: Quid facitis quod non licet in sabbatis?
verses.english: Some Pharisees said, “Why are you doing things that are not allowed on the Sabbath?”

verses.latin: Et respondens Jesus ad eos, dixit: Nec hoc legistis quod fecit David, cum esuriisset ipse, et qui cum illo erant?
verses.english: Jesus answered, “Haven’t you read about how David and those who were with him did when they were hungry?

verses.latin: quomodo intravit in domum Dei, et panes propositionis sumpsit, et manducavit, et dedit his qui cum ipso erant: quos non licebat manducare, nisi solis sacerdotibus?
verses.english: He went into God’s house, and took the bread offered to God, and ate it, and gave it to his companions. He was not permitted to eat this bread because it was only for the priests.

verses.latin: Et dicebat illis: Quia dominus est Filius hominis etiam sabbati.
verses.english: Then He told them, “The Son of Man is Lord, even of the Sabbath.”

verses.latin: Factum est autem in alia sabbati, et ipse introivit in synagogam, et docebat. Et erat ibi homo, et manus ejus arida.
verses.english: On another Sabbath, Jesus entered the synagogue and began to teach. There was a man there whose right hand was shriveled.

verses.latin: Observabant autem scribae et pharisaei si in sabbato curaret, ut invenirent unde accusarent eum.
verses.english: The scribes and the Pharisees watched Him closely to see if He would heal on the Sabbath, so they could accuse Him.

verses.latin: Ipse vero sciebat cogitationes eorum: et dixit homini qui habebat manum aridam: Surge, et sta in medium. Et ille surgens, stetit.
verses.english: Jesus knew what they were thinking. He said to the man with the shriveled hand, “Get up and stand in the middle.” He got up and stood there.

verses.latin: Ait autem Jesus ad illos: Interrogo vos, si licet sabbato benefacere, an male: animam salvam facere, an perdere?
verses.english: Jesus then said to them, “I ask you, is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath, or to do evil? To save a life, or to destroy it?”

verses.latin: Et circumspiciens omnes, dixit homini: Extende manum tuam. Et extendit: et restituta est manus ejus.
verses.english: Then He looked around at everyone. He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” The man did so, and his hand was restored.

verses.latin: Ipsi autem repleti sunt insipientia, et colloquebantur ad invicem quidnam facerent Jesu.
verses.english: But they were filled with rage, and began to talk about what they should do to Jesus.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in illis diebus, exiit in montem orare, et erat pernoctans in oratione Dei.
verses.english: In these days, Jesus went out to the mountain to pray, and He spent the night in prayer to God.

verses.latin: Et cum dies factus esset, vocavit discipulos suos: et elegit duodecim ex ipsis (quos et apostolos nominavit):
verses.english: When the sun rose, He called His disciples and chose twelve of them, whom He also named Apostles.

verses.latin: Simonem, quem cognominavit Petrum, et Andream fratrem ejus, Jacobum et Joannem, Philippum et Bartholomaeum,
verses.english: Simon, whom He named Peter, and Andrew, his brother; James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,

verses.latin: Matthaeum et Thomam, Jacobum Alphaei, et Simonem, qui dicitur Zelotes,
verses.english: Matthew and Thomas; James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon, who is called the Zealot,

verses.latin: Judam Jacobi, et Judam Iscariotem, qui fuit proditor.
verses.english: Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who was a traitor.

verses.latin: Et descendens cum illis, stetit in loco campestri, et turba discipulorum ejus, et multitudo copiosa plebis de tota Judaea et Jerosolyma, et maritima, et Tyri, et Sidonis,
verses.english: He came down with them and stood on a level place, and a large crowd of His disciples, and a great multitude of people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon.

verses.latin: qui venerant ut audirent eum, et sanarentur a languoribus suis: et qui vexabantur a spiritibus immundis, curabantur.
verses.english: They had come to hear Him and be healed of their diseases. Those tormented by evil spirits were cured.

verses.latin: Et omnis turba querebat eum tangere eum: quia virtus de illo exibat, et sanabat omnes.
verses.english: And all the crowd were trying to touch Him, because power was coming from Him that was healing everyone.

verses.latin: Et ipse, elevatis oculis in discipulos suos, dicebat: Beati pauperes, quia vestra est regnum Dei.
verses.english: Then Jesus looked at His disciples and said: “Blessed are you who are poor, because yours is the kingdom of God.

verses.latin: Beati qui esuritis nunc, quia saturabimini. Beati qui fletis nunc, quia ridebitis.
verses.english: Blessed are you who hunger now, because you will be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, because you will laugh.

verses.latin: Beati eritis cum vos oderint homines, et cum separaverint vos, et exprobraverint, et ejecerint nomen vestrum tamquam malum, propter Filium hominis.
verses.english: Blessed are you when people hate you, and when they exclude you and revile you, and reject your name as evil, on account of the Son of Man.

verses.latin: Gaudete in illa die, et exsultate: ecce enim merces vestra multa est in caelo: secundum haec enim faciebant prophetis patres eorum.
verses.english: Rejoice on that day and leap for joy, because your reward is great in the universe. Their ancestors treated the prophets in the same way.

verses.latin: Verumtamen vae vobis divitibus, quia habetis consolationem vestram.
verses.english: But woe to you who are rich, because you have received your consolation.

verses.latin: Vae vobis qui saturati estis, quia esurietis. Vae vobis qui ridetis nunc, quia flebitis et plorabitis.
verses.english: Woe to you who are full now, because you will be hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, because you will mourn and weep.

verses.latin: Vae cum benedixerint vobis omnes homines: secundum haec enim faciebant pseudoprophetis patres eorum.
verses.english: Woe to you when all speak well of you, for their ancestors treated the false prophets in the same way.

verses.latin: Sed vobis dico qui auditis: Diligite inimicos vestros, benefacite his qui oderunt vos.
verses.english: But I say to you who hear: Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you.

verses.latin: Benedicite maledicentes vos, et orate pro calumniantibus vos.
verses.english: Bless those who curse you, and pray for those who mistreat you.

verses.latin: Et qui te percutit in unam maxillam, praebe et alteram: et ab eo qui aufert tibi vestimentum, ne prohibeas et tunicam.
verses.english: To the one who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other also. From the one who takes away your cloak, do not withhold your tunic either.

verses.latin: Omni autem petenti te, tribue: et qui aufert quae tua sunt, ne repetas.
verses.english: Give to everyone who asks you, and do not ask for your belongings back from the one who takes them away.

verses.latin: Et prout vultis ut faciant vobis homines, et vos facite illis similiter.
verses.english: And as you want people to do to you, do the same to them.

verses.latin: Et si diligitis eos qui vos diligunt, quae vobis est gratia? nam et peccatores diligunt eos qui se diligunt.
verses.english: If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? Even sinners love those who love them.

verses.latin: Et si benefeceritis his qui vobis benefaciunt, quae vobis est gratia? nam et peccatores hoc faciunt.
verses.english: If you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? Even sinners do that.

verses.latin: Et si mutuum dederitis his a quibus speratis recipere, quae vobis est gratia? nam et peccatores peccatoribus faenerant, ut recipiant aequalia.
verses.english: And if you lend to those from whom you expect to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners to get back the same amount.

verses.latin: Verumtamen diligite inimicos vestros: et benefacite: et mutuam date, nihil inde sperantes: et erit merces vestra multa, et eritis filii Altissimi: quia ipse benignus est super ingratos et malos.
verses.english: But love your enemies, do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return. Your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High, for He is kind to the ungrateful and the wicked.

verses.latin: Estote misericordes, sicut et Pater vester misericors est.
verses.english: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.

verses.latin: Nolite judicare, et non judicabimini: nolite damnare, et non damnabimini. Dimittite, et dimittemini.
verses.english: Do not judge, and you will not be judged. Do not condemn, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.

verses.latin: Date, et dabitur vobis: mensuram bonam, et confertam, et coagitatam, et supereffluentem dabunt in sinum vestrum. Eadem enim mensura, qua mensi fueritis, remetietur vobis.
verses.english: Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and overflowing, will be poured into your lap. For with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.”

verses.latin: Dicebat autem illis et similitudinem: Numquid potest caecus caecum ducere? nonne ambo in foveam cadunt?
verses.english: He also told them this parable: “Can a blind man lead a blind man? Will they not both fall into a pit?

verses.latin: Non est discipulus super magistrum: perfectus autem omnis erit, si sit sicut magister ejus.
verses.english: A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone who is fully trained will be like their teacher.

verses.latin: Quid autem vides festucam in oculo fratris tui: trabem autem, quae in oculo tuo est, non consideras?
verses.english: Why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but do not notice the log that is in your own eye?

verses.latin: Aut quomodo potes dicere fratri tuo: Frater, sine ejiciam festucam de oculo tuo: ipse in oculo tuo trabem non videns? Hypocrita, ejice primum trabem de oculo tuo: et tunc videbis ut educas festucam de oculo fratris tui.
verses.english: Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck from your eye,’ when you yourself do not see the log in your own eye? You hypocrite, first remove the log from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck that is in your brother’s eye.

verses.latin: Non enim est arbor bona, quae facit fructum malum: neque iterum arbor mala, quae facit fructum bonum.
verses.english: For no good tree produces bad fruit, nor does a bad tree produce good fruit.

verses.latin: Unaquaeque enim arbor de fructu suo cognoscitur. Neque enim de spinis colligunt ficus: neque de rubo vindemiant uvas.
verses.english: Each tree is known by its own fruit. For figs are not gathered from thorns, nor are grapes picked from a bramble bush.

verses.latin: Bonus homo de bono thesauro cordis sui profert bonum: et malus homo de malo thesauro profert malum. Ex abundantia enim cordis os loquitur.
verses.english: The good person brings forth good things from the good treasury of his heart, and the evil person brings forth evil things from the evil treasury. For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.

verses.latin: Quid autem vocatis me Domine, Domine: et non facitis quae dico?
verses.english: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and do not do what I say?

verses.latin: Omnis qui venit ad me, et audit verba mea, et facit ea, ostendam vobis cui similis sit.
verses.english: I will show you what someone is like who comes to me and hears my words and acts on them.

verses.latin: Similis est homini aedificanti domum, qui fodit in altum, et posuit fundamentum super petram: inundatione autem facta, illisa est fluminis illi domui, et non potuit eam movere: fundata enim erat supra petram.
verses.english: That person is like a man building a house, who dug deep and laid the foundation on the rock. When a flood came, the river beat against that house, but it could not shake it, because it was well built.

verses.latin: Qui autem audit, et non facit, similis est homini aedificanti domum super terram sine fundamento: in quam illisa fluminis, statim corruit: et facta est ruina domus illius magna.
verses.english: But the one who hears and does not act is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. When the river beat against it, the house immediately fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”

verses.latin: Cum expletis verbis suis in auribus plebis, intravit Capharnaum.
verses.english: When Jesus finished speaking to the people, he went into Capernaum.

verses.latin: Centurionis autem cuiusdam servus, male habens, moriebatur: qui illi erat carus.
verses.english: A centurion's servant was very ill and near death—he was very dear to the centurion.

verses.latin: Cumque audisset de Iesu, misit ad eum seniores Iudaeorum, rogans eum ut veniret et salvum faceret servum eius.
verses.english: When he heard about Jesus, he sent elders of the Jews to beg him to come and heal his servant.

verses.latin: At illi cum venissent ad Iesum, rogabant eum sollicite, dicentes: Quia dignus est ut hoc illi præstes:
verses.english: When they came to Jesus, they earnestly pleaded with him, saying, “This man deserves your help,

verses.latin: Diligit enim gentem nostram, et synagogam ipse ædificavit nobis.
verses.english: because he loves our people, and he built our synagogue.”

verses.latin: Ibat autem Iesus cum illis. Et cum iam non longe esset a domo, misit ad eum centurio amicos, dicens: Domine, noli vexari: non enim dignus sum ut sub tectum meum intres:
verses.english: So Jesus went with them. And when he was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends, saying, “Lord, do not trouble yourself, for I am not worthy to have you enter my home,

verses.latin: propter quod et me ipsum non sum dignum putavi ut venirem ad te. Sed dic verbo, et sanabitur puer meus.
verses.english: and that is why I did not even consider myself worthy to come to you. Just give the order, and my servant will be healed.

verses.latin: Nam et ego homo sum sub potestate constitutus, habens sub me milites: et dico huic: Vade, et vadit: et alio: Veni, et venit: et servo meo: Fac hoc, et facit.
verses.english: For I myself am a man subject to authority, with soldiers subject to me. I tell this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”

verses.latin: Qua audita, Iesus miratus est: et conversus, sequenti populo dixit: Amen dico vobis, nec in Israhel tantam fidem inveni.
verses.english: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed and said to the crowd following him, “I tell you, I have not found such faith even in Israel.”

verses.latin: Et reversi in domum, qui missi fuerant, servum sanum invenerunt, qui aegrotus fuerat.
verses.english: And when those who had been sent returned to the house, they found the servant well.

verses.latin: Et factum est deinceps, ibat in civitatem, quae vocabatur Naim: et ibant cum illo discipuli eius, et turba copiosa.
verses.english: Soon afterward, Jesus went to a town called Nain, and his disciples and a large crowd went along with him.

verses.latin: Cum autem appropinquasset portae civitatis, ecce defunctus efferebatur filius unicus matris suae: et hæc vidua erat: et turba civitatis multa cum illa.
verses.english: As he approached the gate of the town, a dead man was being carried out—the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. A large crowd from the town was with her.

verses.latin: Quam videns Dominus, misericordia motus est super eam, et dixit illi: Noli flere.
verses.english: When the Lord saw her, his heart went out to her, and he said, “Do not weep.”

verses.latin: Et accessit, et tetigit lectum. Qui autem portabant, steterunt. Et ait: Adolescens, tibi dico, surge.
verses.english: Then he went up and touched the coffin, and the bearers stood still. He said, “Young man, I say to you, get up!”

verses.latin: Et resedit ille qui mortuus fuerat, et cœpit loqui. Et dedit illum matri suae.
verses.english: The dead man sat up and began to speak, and Jesus gave him to his mother.

verses.latin: Et timor tenuit omnes: et magnificabant Deum, dicentes: Quia propheta magnus surrexit in nobis: et, Quia visitavit Deus plebem suam.
verses.english: Fear seized them all, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has appeared among us!” and, “God has come to help his people.”

verses.latin: Et exiit fama haec in universam Iudaeam, et omnem regionem circa se.
verses.english: This news about him spread throughout Judea and the surrounding area.

verses.latin: Et nuntiaverunt Ioanni discipuli eius de omnibus his.
verses.english: John’s disciples told him about all these things.

verses.latin: Et convocavit Ioannes duos ex discipulis suis: et misit ad Iesum, dicens: Tu es qui venturus es, an alium exspectamus?
verses.english: Calling two of his disciples, John sent them to the Lord to ask, “Are you the one who is to come, or should we expect someone else?”

verses.latin: Cum autem venissent viri ad eum, dixerunt: Ioannes Baptista misit nos ad te, dicens: Tu es qui venturus es, an alium exspectamus?
verses.english: When the men came to Jesus, they said, “John the Baptist sent us to you to ask, ‘Are you the one who is to come, or should we expect someone else?’”

verses.latin: In ipsa autem hora curavit multos de languoribus, et plagis, et spiritibus malis: et multis caecis donavit visum.
verses.english: At that very time Jesus cured many who were sick with various diseases, and he cast out many demons; and he granted sight to many who were blind.

verses.latin: Et respondens dixit illis: Euntes renuntiate Ioanni quae vidistis et audistis: quia caeci vident, claudi ambulant, leprosi mundantur, surdi audiunt, mortui resurgunt, pauperes evangelizantur:
verses.english: So he replied to the messengers, “Go back and report to John what you have seen and heard: The blind receive sight, the lame walk, those with leprosy are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the good news is proclaimed to the poor.

verses.latin: et beatus est, qui non fuerit scandalizatus in me.
verses.english: Blessed is anyone who does not stumble on account of me.”

verses.latin: Apostolis autem Ioannis cum abiissent, cœpit dicere ad turbas de Ioanne: Quid existis in desertum videre? arundinem vento agitari?
verses.english: After John’s messengers left, Jesus began to speak to the crowd concerning John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed swayed by the wind?

verses.latin: Sed quid existis videre? hominem mollibus vestitum? ecce qui in veste pretiosa sunt, et delicati, in domibus regum sunt.
verses.english: If not, what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? Those who wear expensive clothes and indulge in luxury are in royal palaces.

verses.latin: Sed quid existis videre? prophetam? Etiam dico vobis, et plus quam prophetam.
verses.english: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.

verses.latin: Hic est enim de quo scriptum est: Ecce mitto angelum meum ante faciem tuam, qui præparabit viam tuam ante te.
