verses.english: This is the one about whom it is written: ‘I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.’

verses.latin: Dico enim vobis, inter natos mulierum, nemo major est Ioanne Baptista. Qui autem minor est in regno Dei, major est illo.
verses.english: I tell you, among those born of women, there is no one greater than John; yet the one who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”

verses.latin: Et omnis populus audiens, et publicani, iustificaverunt Deum, baptizati baptismo Ioannis.
verses.english: All the people, even the tax collectors, when they heard this, acknowledged that God was in the right, because they had been baptized with John’s baptism.

verses.latin: Pharisæi autem et legis periti, consilium Dei spreverunt in semetipsos, non baptizati ab eo.
verses.english: But the Pharisees and the experts in the law rejected God’s purpose for themselves, because they had not been baptized by John.

verses.latin: Cui ergo similes dicam homines generationis huius? et cui similes sunt?
verses.english: To what, then, can I compare the people of this generation? What are they like?

verses.latin: Similes sunt pueris sedentibus in foro, et loquentibus ad invicem, dicentibus: Cantavimus vobis, et non saltastis: planximus vobis, et non flepistis.
verses.english: They are like children sitting in the marketplace and calling out to each other: ‘We played the flute for you, and you did not dance; we sang a dirge, and you did not mourn.’

verses.latin: Venit enim Ioannes Baptista neque panem manducans, neque bibens vinum: et dicitis: Daemonium habet.
verses.english: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’

verses.latin: Venit Filius hominis manducans et bibens: et dicitis: Ecce homo vorax, et potor vini, amicus publicanorum et peccatorum.
verses.english: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Here is a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners.’

verses.latin: Et justificata est sapientia ab omnibus filiis suis.
verses.english: But wisdom is proved right by all her children.”

verses.latin: Rogabat autem illum quidam de Pharisæis, ut manducaret cum illo. Et ingressus domum Pharisaei, discubuit.
verses.english: Now one of the Pharisees invited Jesus to have dinner with him, so he went to the Pharisee’s house and reclined at the table.

verses.latin: Et ecce mulier, quae erat in civitate peccatrix, ut cognovit quod discumberet in domo Pharisaei, attulit alabastrum unguenti:
verses.english: A woman in that town who lived a sinful life learned that Jesus was eating at the Pharisee’s house, so she came with a jar of expensive perfume.

verses.latin: et stans retro secus pedes eius, lacrimis cœpit rigare pedes eius, et capillis capitis sui tergebat, et osculabatur pedes eius, et unguebat unguento.
verses.english: As she stood behind him at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears. Then she wiped them with her hair, kissed them and poured perfume on them.

verses.latin: Videns autem Pharisaeus, qui invitaverat eum, ait intra se, dicens: Hic si esset propheta, sciret utique quae et qualis est mulier, quae tangit eum: quia peccatrix est.
verses.english: When the Pharisee who had invited him saw this, he said to himself, “If this man were a prophet, he would know who is touching him and what kind of woman she is—that she is a sinner.”

verses.latin: Et respondens Iesus, dixit ad illum: Simon, habeo tibi aliquid dicere. At ille ait: Magister, dic.
verses.english: Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to tell you.” “Tell me, teacher,” he said.

verses.latin: Duo debitores erant cuidam fœneratori: unus debebat denarios quingentos, et alius quinquaginta.
verses.english: “Two people owed money to a certain money lender. One owed him five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.

verses.latin: Non habentibus illis unde redderent, omnibus donavit. Quis ergo eum ex illis plus diliget?
verses.english: Neither of them could pay him back, so he forgave the debts of both. Now which of them will love him more?”

verses.latin: Respondens Simon, dixit: Existimo quia is cui plus donavit. Ait illi: Recte judicasti.
verses.english: Simon replied, “I suppose the one who had the bigger debt forgiven.” “You have judged correctly,” Jesus said.

verses.latin: Et conversus ad mulierem, dixit Simoni: Vides hanc mulierem? Intravi in domum tuam, aquam pedes mihi non dedisti: haec autem lacrimis rigavit pedes meos, et capillis suis tersit.
verses.english: Then he turned toward the woman and said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I came into your house. You did not give me any water for my feet, but she wet my feet with her tears and wiped them with her hair.

verses.latin: Osculum mihi non dedisti: haec autem, ex quo intravi, non cessavit osculari pedes meos.
verses.english: You did not give me a kiss, but this woman, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss my feet.

verses.latin: Oleo caput meum non unxisti: haec autem unguento unxit pedes meos.
verses.english: You did not put oil on my head, but she has poured perfume on my feet.

verses.latin: Propter quod dico tibi: Remittuntur peccata eius multa, quoniam dilexit multum. Cui autem minus dimittitur, minus diligit.
verses.english: Therefore, I tell you, her many sins have been forgiven—as her great love has shown. But whoever has been forgiven little loves little.”

verses.latin: Ait autem ad illam: Remittuntur tibi peccata.
verses.english: Then Jesus said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”

verses.latin: Et cœperunt qui simul discumbebant dicere intra se: Quis est hic, qui etiam peccata dimittit?
verses.english: The other guests began to say among themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”

verses.latin: Dixit autem ad mulierem: Fides tua te salvam fecit: vade in pace.
verses.english: Jesus said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”

verses.latin: Et factum est deinceps, et ipse iter faciebat per civitates et castella, praedicans et evangelizans regnum Dei: et duodecim cum illo,
verses.english: After this, Jesus Christ traveled through the cities and villages, preaching and proclaiming the Kingdom of God; and the twelve apostles were with Him,

verses.latin: et mulieres quaedam, quae erant curatae a spiritibus malis et infirmitatibus: Maria, quae vocatur Magdalena, de qua daemonia septem exierant,
verses.english: and some women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary, who is called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out,

verses.latin: et Joanna uxor Chusae procuratoris Herodis, et Susanna, et aliae multae, quae ministrabant illis de facultatibus suis.
verses.english: and Joanna the wife of Chusa, Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others, who provided for them from their resources.

verses.latin: Confluentibus autem turbis plurimis, et de civitatibus currentibus ad eum, dixit per similitudinem:
verses.english: And when a very large crowd was gathering, and people were coming to Him from every city, He said this parable:

verses.latin: Exiit qui seminat, seminare semen suum. Et dum seminat, aliud cecidit secus viam, et conculcatum est, et volucres caeli comederunt illud.
verses.english: “A sower went out to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell beside the way and was trodden down, and the birds of the sky ate it up.

verses.latin: Et aliud cecidit supra petram: et natum aruit, quia non habebat humorem.
verses.english: “And some fell on the rock; and as soon as it sprang up, it withered away because it had no moisture.

verses.latin: Et aliud cecidit inter spinas: et simul exortae spinae suffocaverunt illud.
verses.english: “And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprang up with it and choked it.

verses.latin: Et aliud cecidit in terram bonam: et ortum fecit fructum centuplum. Haec dicens clamabat: Qui habet aures ad audiendum, audiat.
verses.english: “And some fell on the good ground, and sprang up, and produced a hundredfold.” As He said these things, He called out, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

verses.latin: Interrogabant autem eum discipuli ejus, quae esset haec parabola.
verses.english: Then His disciples asked Him what this parable meant.

verses.latin: Quibus ipse dixit: Vobis datum est nosse mysterium regni Dei: ceteris in parabolis, ut videntes non videant, et audientes non intellegant.
verses.english: And He said, “To you it has been given to know the mystery of the Kingdom of God; but to the rest, it is in parables, so that seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.

verses.latin: Est autem haec parabola: Semen est verbum Dei.
verses.english: “Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

verses.latin: Qui autem secus viam, hi sunt qui audiunt: deinde venit diabolus, et tollit verbum de corde eorum, ne credentes salventur.
verses.english: “Those by the way are those who hear; then the devil comes and takes away the word from their heart, so that they may not believe and be saved.

verses.latin: Nam qui supra petram, hi sunt qui, cum audierint, cum gaudio suscipiunt verbum: et hi radices non habent: qui ad tempus credunt, et in tempore tentationis recedunt.
verses.english: “Those on the rock are those who, when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, who believe for a while and in time of temptation fall away.

verses.latin: Quod autem in spinas cecidit, hi sunt qui audierunt, et a curis et divitiis et voluptatibus vitae euntes, suffocantur, et non referunt fructum.
verses.english: “And what fell among the thorns are those who have heard, and as they go, are choked by the cares and riches and pleasures of life, and they do not bear fruit.

verses.latin: Quod autem in bonam terram, hi sunt qui in corde bono et optimo audientes verbum, retinent, et fructum adferunt in patientia.
verses.english: “But what fell on the good ground are those who, in a good and honest heart, having heard the word, keep it and bear fruit with patience.

verses.latin: Nemo autem accendit lucernam, et operit eam vasculo, aut sub lectulo ponit: sed super candelabrum ponit, ut intrantes videant lucem.
verses.english: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a vessel or puts it under a bed, but puts it on a lampstand, so that those who enter may see the light.

verses.latin: Non enim est occultum, quod non manifestabitur: neque secretum, quod non scietur et in palam veniet.
verses.english: “For nothing is hidden that will not be made manifest, nor is anything secret that will not be known and come to light.

verses.latin: Videte itaque quomodo audiatis. Qui enim habet, dabitur illi: et quicumque non habet, etiam quod putat se habere, auferetur ab eo.
verses.english: “Take heed therefore how you hear. For whoever has, to him more will be given; and whoever does not have, even what he thinks he has will be taken away from him.”

verses.latin: Venerunt autem ad illum mater et fratres ejus: et non poterant adire illum prae turba.
verses.english: Then His mother and brothers came to Him, but they could not get to Him because of the crowd.

verses.latin: Et nuntiatum est illi: Mater tua et fratres tui stant foris, volentes te videre.
verses.english: And it was told Him, “Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, desiring to see You.”

verses.latin: Qui respondens, dixit ad illos: Mater mea et fratres mei hi sunt, qui verbum Dei audiunt, et faciunt.
verses.english: But He answered and said to them, “My mother and My brothers are these who hear the word of God and do it.”

verses.latin: Factum est autem in una dierum, et ipse ascendit in navim, et discipuli ejus: et ait ad illos: Transfretemus in transitus stagni. Et ascenderunt.
verses.english: Now it happened on a certain day that He got into a boat with His disciples, and He said to them, “Let us cross over to the other side of the lake.” And they launched out.

verses.latin: Navigantibus autem illis, obdormivit: et descendit procella venti in stagnum, et complebantur: et periclitabantur.
verses.english: But as they sailed, He fell asleep; and a tempest of wind descended on the lake, and they were filling with water, and were in jeopardy.

verses.latin: Accedentes autem commoverunt eum, dicentes: Praeceptor, perimus. At ipse surgens, increpavit ventum, et tempestatem aquae: et desierunt, et facta est tranquillitas.
verses.english: And they came to Him and awoke Him, saying, “Master, Master, we are perishing!” Then He arose and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water, and they ceased, and there was a calm.

verses.latin: Dixit autem illis: Ubi est fides vestra? Qui conturbati, mirati sunt, dicentes ad invicem: Quisnam hic est, quia et ventis imperat et aquae, et obediunt ei?
verses.english: But He said to them, “Where is your faith?” And they, afraid, marveled, saying to one another, “Who can this be? For He commands even the winds and water, and they obey Him!”

verses.latin: Et navigaverunt ad regionem Gerasenorum, quae est contra Galilaeam.
verses.english: Then they sailed to the country of the Gerasenes, which is opposite Galilee.

verses.latin: Et cum exiisset ad terram, occurrit illi quidam homo qui habebat daemonium, et jam per multum tempus vestimentis non induebatur, neque in domo manebat, sed in monumentis.
verses.english: And when He stepped out on the land, there met Him a certain man from the city who had demons for a long time. He was not wearing clothes, nor did he live in a house, but in the tombs.

verses.latin: Is cum vidisset Jesum, exclamans procidit ante eum: et voce magna dixit: Quid mihi et tibi, Jesu, fili Dei altissimi? Obsecro te, ne torqueas me.
verses.english: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before Him, and with a loud voice said, “What have I to do with You, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg You, do not torment me!”

verses.latin: (Praecipiebat enim spiritui immundo exire ab homine. Multis enim temporibus arripiebat eum: et vinciebatur catenis et compedibus custoditus: et dirumpens vincula, agebatur a daemonio in solitudinem.)
verses.english: For He had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For often it had seized him, and he was kept under guard, bound with chains and shackles; and breaking the bonds, he was driven by the demon into the wilderness.

verses.latin: Interrogavit autem illum Jesus, dicens: Quod tibi nomen est? At ille dixit: Legio. Quia intraverant multi daemones in eum.
verses.english: Jesus asked him, saying, “What is your name?” And he said, “Legion,” because many demons had entered him.

verses.latin: Et rogabant illum ne imperaret illis abire in abyssum.
verses.english: And they begged Him that He would not command them to go out into the abyss.

verses.latin: Erat autem ibi grex porcorum multorum pascentium in monte: et rogabant eum ut permitteret eos intrare in illos. Et permisit illis.
verses.english: Now a herd of many swine was feeding there on the mountain. And they begged Him that He would permit them to enter them. And He permitted them.

verses.latin: Exierunt ergo daemones ab homine, et introierunt in porcos: et procella se dedit per praecipitium in stagnum, et suffocati sunt.
verses.english: Then the demons went out of the man and entered the swine, and the herd ran violently down the steep place into the lake and were drowned.

verses.latin: Videns autem quod factum est, pastores fugerunt, et nuntiaverunt in civitatem et in villas.
verses.english: When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled and told it in the city and in the country.

verses.latin: Et exierunt videre quod factum est: et venerunt ad Jesum, et invenerunt hominem a quo daemones exierant, sedentem ad pedes Jesu, vestitum et sanae mentis: et timuerunt.
verses.english: Then they went out to see what had happened, and came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed and in his right mind. And they were afraid.

verses.latin: Et nuntiaverunt illis qui viderant, quomodo sanatus esset a daemonio.
verses.english: And those who had seen it told them how he who had been demon-possessed was healed.

verses.latin: Et rogaverunt illum tota multitudo regionis Gerasenorum, ut discederet ab eis: quia timore magno tenebantur. Ipse autem ascendens in navim, reversus est.
verses.english: Then the whole multitude of the region of the Gerasenes asked Him to depart from them, for they were seized with great fear. And He got into a boat and returned.

verses.latin: Rogabat autem illum vir a quo daemones exierant, ut posset esse cum illo. Et dimisit eum Jesus, dicens:
verses.english: Now the man from whom the demons had departed begged Him that he might be with Him. But Jesus sent him away, saying,

verses.latin: Revertere in domum tuam, et narra quanta tibi fecit Deus. Et abiit per universam civitatem, praedicans quanta illi fecisset Jesus.
verses.english: “Return to your own house, and tell what great things God has done for you.” And he went his way, proclaiming throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum reverteretur Jesus, suscepit eum turba: erant enim omnes expectantes eum.
verses.english: Now it was, when Jesus returned, that the multitude welcomed Him, for they were all waiting for Him.

verses.latin: Et ecce venit vir, cui nomen Jairus: et ipse princeps synagogae erat: et cecidit ad pedes Jesu, et rogabat eum ut veniret in domum ejus:
verses.english: And behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue. And he fell down at Jesus’ feet and begged Him to come to his house,

verses.latin: quia filia unica erat illi, quasi annorum duodecim, et haec moriebatur. Et ibant illi. Et turbae comprimebant eum.
verses.english: for he had an only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as He went, the multitudes thronged Him.

verses.latin: Et mulier quaedam, quae fluxum sanguinis patiebatur ab annis duodecim, quae in medicos erogaverat omnem substantiam suam, nec potuit ab aliquo curari,
verses.english: Now a woman, having a flow of blood for twelve years, who had spent all her livelihood on physicians and could not be healed by anyone,

verses.latin: accessit retro, et tetigit oram vestimenti ejus: et statim stetit fluxus sanguinis ejus.
verses.english: came behind Him and touched the border of His garment. And immediately her flow of blood stopped.

verses.latin: Et dixit Jesus: Quis est qui me tetigit? Negantibus autem omnibus, dixit Petrus, et qui cum illo erant: Praeceptor, turbae conprimunt te, et te ingerunt, et dicis: Quis me tetigit?
verses.english: And Jesus said, “Who touched Me?” When all denied it, Peter and those with him said, “Master, the multitudes throng and press You, and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’

verses.latin: Et dixit Jesus: Tetigit me aliquis: ego enim sensi virtutem de me exiisse.
verses.english: But Jesus said, “Someone touched Me, for I perceived power going out from Me.”

verses.latin: Videns autem mulier quia non latuit, tremens venit, et procidit ante eum: et enarravit illi coram omni populo ob quam causam tetigerat eum, et quomodo confestim sanata esset.
verses.english: Now when the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling; and falling down before Him, she declared to Him in the presence of all the people the reason she had touched Him and how she was healed immediately.

verses.latin: At ipse dixit illi: Filia, fides tua te salvam fecit: vade in pacem.
verses.english: And He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”

verses.latin: Adhuc eo loquente, venit quidam a principe synagogae, dicens ei: Quia mortua est filia tua, noli molestare eum amplius.
verses.english: While He was still speaking, someone came from the ruler of the synagogue’s house, saying to him, “Your daughter is dead. Do not trouble the Teacher.”

verses.latin: Jesus autem audito, respondit ei: Noli timere, crede tantum, et salva erit.
verses.english: But when Jesus heard it, He answered him, saying, “Do not be afraid; only believe, and she will be made well.”

verses.latin: Et cum venisset in domum, non permisit intrare quemquam, nisi Petrum, et Jacobum, et Joannem, et patrem pueri et matrem.
verses.english: When He came to the house, He permitted no one to enter except Peter, James, and John, and the father and mother of the girl.

verses.latin: Flebat autem omnis, et plangebat illam. Et dixit: Nolite flere: non est mortua, sed dormit.
verses.english: Now all were weeping and mourning for her; but He said, “Do not weep; she is not dead, but sleeping.”

verses.latin: Et deridebant eum, scientes quod mortua esset.
verses.english: And they ridiculed Him, knowing that she was dead.

verses.latin: Ipse autem tenens manum ejus, clamavit, dicens: Puella, surge.
verses.english: But He, taking her by the hand, called out, saying, “Little girl, arise.”

verses.latin: Et reversus est spiritus ejus, et surrexit continuo: et jussit illi dari manducare.
verses.english: Then her spirit returned, and she arose immediately. And He commanded that she be given something to eat.

verses.latin: Et stupuerunt parentes ejus: ipse autem praecepit illis, ne alicui dicerent quod factum erat.
verses.english: And her parents were astonished, but He commanded them to tell no one what had happened.

verses.latin: Collectis autem duodecim Apostolis, dedit illis virtutem et potestatem super omnia dæmonia, et ut languores curarent.
verses.english: Then, collecting the twelve Apostles, He gave them power and authority over all demons, to heal sicknesses.

verses.latin: Et misit illos prædicare regnum Dei, et sanare infirmos.
verses.english: And He sent them to preach the Kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.

verses.latin: Et ait ad illos: Nihil tuleritis in via, neque virgam, neque peram, neque panem, neque pecuniam, neque duas tunicas habeatis.
verses.english: And He said to them: "Take nothing for the journey, neither staff, nor wallet, nor bread, nor money; and do not have two tunics.

verses.latin: Et in quamcumque domum intraveritis, ibi manete, et inde ne exeatis.
verses.english: And into whatsoever house you shall enter, there abide, and do not depart from there.

verses.latin: Et quicumque vos non receperint, exeuntes de civitate illa, excutite etiam pulverem de pedibus vestris in testimonium illis.
verses.english: And whosoever will not receive you, going out of that city, shake off even the dust from your feet for a testimony against them."

verses.latin: Egressi autem circuiebant per castella, evangelizantes et curantes ubique.
verses.english: Going forth, they went about through the towns, preaching the Gospel and healing everywhere.

verses.latin: Audiit autem Herodes tetrarcha omnia quæ fiebant ab eo: et ignorabat quid esset, a quibusdam dicebatur, quia Joannes surrexisset a mortuis:
verses.english: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all things that were done by Him. And he was in doubt, because it was said by some that John was risen from the dead;

verses.latin: a quibusdam vero, quia Elias apparuit: aliis autem, quia propheta unus de prioribus surrexit.
verses.english: but by some, that Elias had appeared; and by others, that one of the prophets of old was risen again.

verses.latin: Et ait Herodes: Joannem quidem ego decollavi: sed hic quis est, de quo ego talia audio? Et quærebat videre eum.
verses.english: And Herod said: "John I have beheaded; but who is this, of whom I hear such things?" And he sought to see Him.

verses.latin: Et reversi Apostoli, narraverunt illi quæ fecerant. Et assumptis illis, secessit seorsum in locum desertum, qui est Bethsaida.
verses.english: And the Apostles, when they were returned, told Him all they had done. And taking them, He went aside into a desert place, which is called Bethsaida.

verses.latin: Quod cum cognovissent turbæ, secutæ sunt illum: et excepit eos, et loquebatur illis de regno Dei, et eos qui cura indigebant, curabat.
verses.english: And when the crowds knew it, they followed Him; and He welcomed them and spoke to them of the Kingdom of God and healed those who had need of healing.

verses.latin: Dies autem cœperat declinare: et accedentes duodecim, dixerunt illi: Dimitte turbas, ut euntes in castella et villas circa, diversentur, et inveniant escas: quia hic in loco deserto sumus.
verses.english: But the day began to decline. And the twelve came and said to Him: "Send away the crowds, that they may go into the towns and the villages around, and lodge, and find provisions, for here we are in a desert place."

verses.latin: Qui dixit ad illos: Date illis vos manducare. At illi dixerunt: Non sunt nobis plus quam quinque panes et duo pisces: nisi forte eamus emere in omnem turbam cibos.
verses.english: But He said to them: "Give them to eat." And they said: "We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless perhaps we go and buy food for all these people."

verses.latin: Erant autem quasi quinque millia virorum. Dixit autem ad discipulos suos: Facite illos discumbere per quinquagenos.
verses.english: For there were about five thousand men. And He said to His disciples: "Make them sit down by fifties in a company."

verses.latin: Et fecerunt ita: et discumbere fecerunt omnes.
verses.english: And they did so, and made them all sit down.

verses.latin: Acceptis autem quinque panibus et duobus piscibus, respexit in cœlum, et benedixit illis: et fregit, et dedit discipulis suis, ut ponerent ante turbas.
verses.english: And taking the five loaves and the two fish, He looked up to heaven and blessed them; and He broke them and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude.

verses.latin: Et manducaverunt omnes, et saturati sunt. Et sublatum est quod superfuerat illis fragmentorum, cofini duodecim.
verses.english: And they all ate and were filled. And there were taken up what remained to them of fragments, twelve baskets.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum solus esset orans, erant cum illo et discipuli: et interrogavit eos, dicens: Quem me dicunt turbae esse?
verses.english: And it came to pass, as He was alone praying, that His disciples were with Him; and He asked them, saying: "Whom do the people say that I am?"

verses.latin: At illi responderunt, et dixerunt: Joannem Baptistam: alii autem, Eliam: alii vero, quoniam propheta unus ex prioribus surrexit.
verses.english: But they answering, said: "John the Baptist"; and others say: "Elias"; and others: "That one of the former prophets has risen again."

verses.latin: Ait illis: Vos autem quem me dicitis esse? Respondens Petrus, dixit: Christum Dei.
verses.english: Then He said to them: "But whom do you say that I am?" Peter answering, said: "The Christ of God."

verses.latin: At ille increpans illos, præcepit ne cui dicerent hoc.
verses.english: But He strictly charged and commanded them to tell this to no one.

verses.latin: Dicens: Quia oportet Filium hominis multa pati, et reprobari a senioribus et principibus sacerdotum et scribis, et occidi, et tertia die resurgere.
verses.english: Saying: "The Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes and be killed and rise again on the third day."

verses.latin: Dicebat autem ad omnes: Si quis vult post me venire, neget semetipsum, et tollat crucem suam quotidie, et sequatur me.
verses.english: And He said to all: "If anyone wishes to come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross every day, and follow Me.

verses.latin: Qui enim voluerit animam suam salvam facere, perdet eam: qui autem perdiderit animam suam propter me, hunc salvum faciet.
verses.english: For whosoever will save his life, shall lose it; but he who shall lose his life for My sake, shall save it.

verses.latin: Quid enim prodest homini, si lucretur universum mundum, se autem ipsum perdat, et detrimentum sui faciat?
verses.english: For what does it profit a man, if he gain the whole world, but lose himself, and suffer harm?

verses.latin: Nam qui me erubuerit, et meos sermones, hunc Filius hominis erubescet, cum venerit in majestate sua, et Patris, et sanctorum angelorum.
verses.english: For whosoever shall be ashamed of Me and of My words, of him the Son of Man will be ashamed, when He shall come in His majesty and that of the Father and of the holy angels.

verses.latin: Dico autem vobis vere, sunt aliqui de hic stantibus, qui non gustabunt mortem, donec videant regnum Dei.
verses.english: And I tell you truly, there are some of those standing here who will not taste death, until they see the kingdom of God."

verses.latin: Factum est autem post hæc verba, quasi dies octo: et assumpsit Petrum, et Joannem, et Jacobum, et ascendit in montem orare.
verses.english: And it came to pass after these words, that He took Peter and John and James and went up the mountain to pray.

verses.latin: Et factum est, dum oraret, species vultus ejus altera est, et vestitus ejus albus et fulgens.
verses.english: And it came to pass, as He was praying, that the appearance of His face was altered, and His clothing became white and shining.

verses.latin: Et ecce duo viri loquebantur cum illo. Erant autem Moyses et Elias,
verses.english: And behold, two men were talking with Him. And they were Moses and Elias,

verses.latin: qui visi in gloria, dicebant de excessu ejus, quem completurus erat in Ierusalem.
verses.english: who, appearing in glory, were speaking of His decease that He was to accomplish in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Petrus autem, et qui cum illo erant, gravati erant somno. Evigilantes autem, viderunt gloriam ejus, et duos viros stantes cum illo.
verses.english: Now Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep. And when they were awake, they saw His glory and the two men standing with Him.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum discederent ab illo, dixit Petrus ad Jesum: Præceptor, bonum est nos hic esse: et faciamus tres tabernaculos, unum tibi, et unum Moysi, et unum Eliæ: nesciens quid diceret.
verses.english: And it came to pass, as they were departing from Him, Peter said to Jesus: "Master, it is good for us to be here. And let us make three tabernacles, one for You, and one for Moses, and one for Elias," not knowing what he said.

verses.latin: Hæc autem illo dicente, facta est nubes, et obumbravit eos. Et timuerunt intrantibus illis in nubem.
verses.english: And as he was saying these things, there came a cloud and overshadowed them. And they were afraid when they entered into the cloud.

verses.latin: Et vox facta est de nube, dicens: Hic est Filius meus dilectus: ipsum audite.
verses.english: And a voice came out of the cloud, saying: "This is My beloved Son; hear Him."

verses.latin: Et dum fieret vox, inventus est Jesus solus. Et tacuerunt, et nemini narraverunt in illis diebus quidquam ex his quæ viderant.
verses.english: And while the voice was made, Jesus was found alone. And they held their peace and told no one in those days any of the things that they had seen.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in sequenti die, descendentibus illis de monte, occurrit illis turba multa.
verses.english: And it came to pass the next day, when they came down from the mountain, that a great crowd met Him.

verses.latin: Et ecce vir de turba exclamavit, dicens: Magister, obsecro te, respice in filium meum, quia unigenitus est mihi:
verses.english: And behold, a man from the crowd cried out, saying: "Master, I beg You, look upon my son, for he is my only child:

verses.latin: et ecce spiritus apprehendit eum, et subito clamat, et dissipat eum cum spumis, et vix discedit ab eo, conterens eum.
verses.english: and behold, a spirit seizes him, and he suddenly cries out and convulses him with foaming, and scarcely departs from him, bruising him.

verses.latin: Et rogavi discipulos tuos ut eicerent eum, et non potuerunt.
verses.english: And I begged Your disciples to cast him out, and they could not."

verses.latin: Respondens autem Jesus, dixit: O generatio infidelis et perversa, usquequo ero vobiscum, et patiar vos? Adduc huc filium tuum.
verses.english: And Jesus answering, said: "O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and suffer you? Bring your son here."

verses.latin: Et cum accederet, elisit illum dæmonium, et laceravit. Et increpavit Jesus spiritum immundum, et sanavit puerum, et reddidit illum patri ejus.
verses.english: And as he was coming, the devil threw him down and tore him. And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit and healed the boy and gave him back to his father.

verses.latin: Et stupuerunt omnes in magnitudine Dei. Omnibus autem mirantibus in omnibus quæ faciebat, dixit ad discipulos suos:
verses.english: And they were all astonished at the greatness of God. But while all were wondering at all the things that He was doing, He said to His disciples:

verses.latin: Ponete vos in cordibus vestris sermones istos: Filius enim hominis futurum est ut tradatur in manus hominum.
verses.english: "Let these words sink down into your ears: For it is destined that the Son of Man shall be delivered into the hands of men."

verses.latin: Qui ignorabant verbum istud: et erat velatum ante eos, ut non sentirent illud: et timebant eum interrogare de hoc verbo.
verses.english: But they did not understand this word; and it was hidden from them, so that they should not perceive it. And they were afraid to ask Him about this word.

verses.latin: Intravit autem cogitatio in eos, quis eorum major esset.
verses.english: Then a thought arose in them, which of them should be the greater.

verses.latin: Jesus autem videns cogitationes cordis illorum, assumens puerum, statuit eum secum.
verses.english: But Jesus, seeing the thoughts of their heart, took a child and placed him beside Himself.

verses.latin: Et ait ad illos: Quicumque susceperit puerum istum in nomine meo, me suscipit: et quicumque me susceperit, suscipit eum qui me misit. Nam qui minor est inter vos omnes, hic major est.
verses.english: And He said to them: "Whosoever shall receive this child in My name, receives Me. And whosoever receives Me, receives Him Who sent Me. For he who is the lesser among you all, he is the greater."

verses.latin: Respondens autem Joannes, dixit: Præceptor, vidimus quendam in nomine tuo eicientem dæmonia, et prohibuimus eum: quia non sequitur nobiscum.
verses.english: And John answering, said: "Master, we saw someone casting out demons in Your name, and we forbade him, because he does not follow with us."

verses.latin: Et ait ad illum Jesus: Nolite prohibere: qui enim non est contra vos, pro vobis est.
verses.english: And Jesus said to him: "Do not forbid him; for he who is not against you is for you."

verses.latin: Factum est autem, dum complerentur dies assumptionis ejus, et ipse faciem suam firmavit ut iret in Ierusalem.
verses.english: And it came to pass, when the days of His assumption were being fulfilled, that He steadfastly set His face to go to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et misit nuntios ante faciem suam. Et euntes intraverunt in civitatem Samaritanorum, ut pararent ei.
verses.english: And He sent messengers before His face; and going in, they entered into a city of the Samaritans, to prepare for Him.

verses.latin: Et non receperunt eum, quia facies ejus erat euntes in Ierusalem.
verses.english: And they did not receive Him, because His face was going toward Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Cum vidissent autem discipuli ejus, Jacobus et Joannes, dixerunt: Domine, vis, dicamus ut ignis descendat de cœlo, et consumat illos?
verses.english: And when His disciples James and John saw this, they said: "Lord, do You want us to command fire to come down from heaven and consume them?"

verses.latin: Et conversus, increpavit illos. Et dixerunt: Nescitis cujus spiritus estis.
verses.english: And turning, He rebuked them, saying: "You do not know of what spirit you are."

verses.latin: Filius hominis non venit animas perdere, sed salvum facere. Et abierunt in aliud castellum.
verses.english: The Son of Man came not to destroy souls, but to save them." And they went into another town.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, ambulantibus illis in via, dixit quidam ad illum: Sequar te quocumque ieris.
verses.english: And it came to pass, as they were going on the road, that someone said to Him: "I will follow You wherever You go."

verses.latin: Dixit illi Jesus: Vulpes foveas habent, et volucres cæli nidos: Filius autem hominis non habet ubi caput reclinet.
verses.english: And Jesus said to him: "The foxes have dens, and the birds of the sky nests; but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head."

verses.latin: Ait autem ad alterum: Sequere me. Ille autem dixit: Domine, permitte mihi primum ire, et sepelire patrem meum.
verses.english: And He said to another: "Follow Me." But he said: "Lord, permit me first to go and bury my father."

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Jesus: Sine mortuos sepelire mortuos suos: tu autem vade, et annuntia regnum Dei.
verses.english: And Jesus said to him: "Let the dead bury their dead; but you go and announce the Kingdom of God."

verses.latin: Ait et alter: Sequar te, Domine: sed permitte mihi primum valere his qui domi sunt.
verses.english: And another also said: "I will follow You, Lord; but allow me first to bid farewell to those at home."

verses.latin: Ad quem Jesus ait: Nemo mittens manum suam ad aratrum, et respiciens retro, aptus est regno Dei.
verses.english: To whom Jesus said: "No one putting his hand to the plow and looking back is fit for the Kingdom of God."

verses.latin: Post hæc autem designavit Dominus et alios septuaginta duos: et misit illos binos ante faciem suam in omnem civitatem et locum, quo erat ipse venturus.
verses.english: After these things, the Lord then designated seventy-two others and sent them, two by two, before His face into every city and place where He Himself was about to go.

verses.latin: Dicebat ergo illis: Messis quidem multa, operarii autem pauci. Rogate ergo Dominum messis, ut mittat operarios in messem suam.
verses.english: He said, therefore, to them: "The harvest truly is plentiful, but the laborers are few. Pray, therefore, the Lord of the harvest that He send laborers into His harvest."

verses.latin: Ite: ecce ego mitto vos sicut agnos inter lupos.
verses.english: Go; behold, I send you as lambs among wolves.

verses.latin: Nolite portare sacculum, neque peram, neque calceamenta: et neminem per viam salutaveritis.
verses.english: Do not carry a bag, nor a satchel, nor sandals; and salute no one on the way.

verses.latin: In quamcumque domum intraveritis, primum dicite: Pax huic domui.
verses.english: Into whatsoever house you enter, first say: "Peace be to this house."

verses.latin: Et si ibi fuerit filius pacis, requiescet super illum pax vestra: sin autem, ad vos revertetur.
verses.english: And if a son of peace is there, your peace will rest upon him; but if not, it will return to you.

verses.latin: In eadem autem domo manete, edentes et bibentes quæ apud illos sunt: dignus est enim operarius mercede sua. Nolite transire de domo in domum.
verses.english: And remain in the same house, eating and drinking the things that they have, for the laborer is worthy of his hire. Do not go from house to house.

verses.latin: Et in quamcumque civitatem intraveritis, et susceperint vos, edite quæ vobis apponuntur:
verses.english: And into whatsoever city you enter, and they receive you, eat the things that are set before you:

verses.latin: et sanate infirmos qui in illa sunt, et dicite illis: Appropinquavit in vos regnum Dei.
verses.english: And heal the sick who are in it, and say to them, 'The kingdom of God has come near to you.'

verses.latin: In quamcumque autem civitatem intraveritis, et non susceperint vos, exeuntes in plateas ejus, dicite:
verses.english: But into whatsoever city you enter, and they do not receive you, going out into the streets of the same, say:

verses.latin: Etiam pulverem, qui adhaesit nobis ex civitate vestra, extergimus in vos: tamen hoc scitote, quia appropinquavit regnum Dei.
verses.english: Even the dust that has stuck to us from your city we wipe off against you; however, know this, that the kingdom of God has come near.

verses.latin: Dico vobis, quia Sodomitis in die illa, tolerabilius erit, quam illi civitati.
verses.english: I tell you, that it will be more tolerable for the Sodomites in that day, than for that city.

verses.latin: Væ tibi, Chorazin! væ tibi, Bethsaida! quia si in Tyro et Sidone factæ essent virtutes quæ factæ sunt in vobis, olim in cilicio et cinere sedentes pœniterent.
verses.english: Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the powers that have been done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

verses.latin: Verumtamen Tyro et Sidoni tolerabilius erit in judicio, quam vobis.
verses.english: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment, than for you.

verses.latin: Et tu, Capharnaum, usque ad cælum exaltata? usque ad infernum deprimeris.
verses.english: And you, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be brought down to hell.

verses.latin: Qui vos audit, me audit: et qui vos spernit, me spernit. Qui autem me spernit, spernit eum qui misit me.
verses.english: He who hears you, hears Me; and he who rejects you, rejects Me; and he who rejects Me, rejects Him who sent Me.

verses.latin: Reversi sunt autem septuaginta duo cum gaudio, dicentes: Domine, etiam dæmonia subjiciuntur nobis in nomine tuo.
verses.english: And the seventy-two returned with joy, saying: "Lord, even the demons are subject to us in Your name."

verses.latin: Ait illis: Videbam Satanam sicut fulgur de cælo cadentem.
verses.english: And He said to them: "I saw Satan like lightning falling from the sky.

verses.latin: Ecce dedi vobis potestatem calcandi supra serpentes et scorpiones, et super omnem virtutem inimici: et nihil vobis nocebit.
verses.english: Behold, I have given you power to tread upon serpents and scorpions, and upon all the power of the enemy; and nothing shall harm you.

verses.latin: Verumtamen in hoc nolite gaudere, quia spiritus vobis subjiciuntur: sed gaudete magis, quod nomina vestra scripta sunt in cælis.
verses.english: However, do not rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you; but rejoice more that your names are written in heaven."

verses.latin: In illa hora gaudens spiritu, exclamavit, et dixit: Confiteor tibi, Pater, Domine cæli et terræ, quod abscondisti hæc a sapientibus et prudentibus, et revelasti ea parvulis. Ita, Pater, quoniam sic placuit ante te.
verses.english: In that hour, rejoicing in the Spirit, He exclaimed and said: "I confess to You, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that You have hidden these things from the wise and prudent, and revealed them to little ones. Yes, Father, for so it seemed good in Your sight."

verses.latin: Omnia mihi tradita sunt a Patre meo. Et nemo scit quis sit Filius, nisi Pater: et quis sit Pater, nisi Filius, et cui voluerit Filius revelare.
verses.english: All things have been delivered to Me by My Father. And no one knows who the Son is except the Father, and who the Father is except the Son, and to whom the Son is willing to reveal Him."

verses.latin: Et conversus ad discipulos, dixit: Beati oculi qui vident quæ vos videtis.
verses.english: And turning to the disciples, He said: "Blessed are the eyes that see what you see.

verses.latin: Dico enim vobis, quod multi prophetæ et reges voluerunt videre quæ vos videtis, et non viderunt: et audire quæ auditis, et non audierunt.
verses.english: For I tell you that many prophets and kings have desired to see what you see, and have not seen it; and to hear what you hear, and have not heard it."

verses.latin: Et ecce quidam legisperitus surrexit, tentans illum, et dicens: Magister, quid faciendo vitam æternam possidebo?
verses.english: And behold, a certain lawyer stood up, tempting Him, and saying: "Teacher, what must I do to possess eternal life?"

verses.latin: Qui dixit ad eum: In lege quid scriptum est? quomodo legis?
verses.english: And He said to him: "What is written in the Law? How do you read it?"

verses.latin: Ille respondens, dixit: Diliges Dominum Deum tuum ex toto corde tuo, et ex tota anima tua, et ex tota virtute tua, et ex tota mente tua: et proximum tuum sicut teipsum.
verses.english: He answering said: "You shall love the Lord your God with your whole heart, and with your whole soul, and with all your strength, and with all your mind; and your neighbor as yourself."

verses.latin: Dixitque illi: Recte respondisti: hoc fac, et vives.
verses.english: And He said to him: "You have answered rightly; do this and you will live."

verses.latin: Ille autem volens justificare seipsum, dixit ad Jesum: Et quis est meus proximus?
verses.english: But he, wishing to justify himself, said to Jesus: "And who is my neighbor?"

verses.latin: Suscipiens autem Jesus, dixit: Homo quidam descendebat ab Jerusalem in Jericho, et incidit in latrones, qui etiam spoliatis eum, et plagis illatis, abierunt semivivo eum reliquentes.
verses.english: Jesus answering, said: "A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and he fell among robbers, who also, having stripped him and inflicted wounds, departed, leaving him half dead.

verses.latin: Accidit autem ut sacerdos quidam descenderet eadem via: et videns eum, præteriit.
verses.english: And it happened that a certain priest was going down the same way; and seeing him, he passed by.

verses.latin: Similiter et Levites, cum esset prope locum, et vidit, pertransiit.
verses.english: And likewise a Levite, when he was near the place, and saw him, passed by.

verses.latin: Samaritanus autem quidam iter faciens, venit secus eum: et videns eum, misericordia motus est.
verses.english: But a certain Samaritan, journeying, came near him; and seeing him, he was moved with compassion.

verses.latin: Et appropians alligavit vulnera ejus, infundens oleum et vinum: et imponens illum in jumentum suum, duxit in stabulum, et curam ejus egit.
verses.english: And approaching, he bound up his wounds, pouring in oil and wine; and putting him on his own beast, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

verses.latin: Et altera die protulit duos denarios, et dedit stabulario, et dixit: Curam illius habe: et quodcumque supererogaveris, ego cum rediero, reddam tibi.
verses.english: And on the next day he took out two denarii and gave them to the innkeeper, and said: 'Take care of him; and whatever you spend more, I will repay you when I return.'

verses.latin: Quis horum trium videtur tibi, proximus fuisse illi qui incidit in latrones?
verses.english: Which of these three, do you think, was neighbor to him who fell among the robbers?

verses.latin: At ille dixit: Qui fecit misericordiam in illum. Et ait illi Jesus: Vade, et tu fac similiter.
verses.english: And he said: "He who showed mercy on him." And Jesus said to him: "Go, and do likewise."

verses.latin: Factum est autem, dum irent, et ipse intravit in quoddam castellum: et mulier quædam, Martha nomine, suscepit illum in domum suam.
verses.english: Now it came to pass, as they went, that He entered a certain village; and a certain woman named Martha received Him into her house.

verses.latin: Et huic erat soror nomine Maria, quæ etiam sedens secus pedes Domini, audiebat verbum illius.
verses.english: And she had a sister named Mary, who also, sitting beside the feet of the Lord, was listening to His Word.

verses.latin: Martha autem satagebat circa frequens ministerium. Quæ stetit, et ait: Domine, non est tibi curæ quod soror mea reliquit me solam ministrare? dic ergo illi ut me adjuvet.
verses.english: But Martha was occupied about much serving. Who stood and said: "Lord, do You not care that my sister has left me alone to serve? Tell her, therefore, to help me."

verses.latin: Respondens autem Dominus, dixit illi: Martha, Martha, sollicita es, et turbas circa multa:
verses.english: And the Lord answering, said to her: "Martha, Martha, you are anxious, and you are troubled about many things;

verses.latin: sed unum est necessarium. Maria optimam partem elegit, quæ non auferetur ab ea.
verses.english: but only one thing is necessary. Mary has chosen the good portion, which will not be taken away from her."

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum faceret in loco quodam orationem, ut cessavit, dixit unus ex discipulis ejus ad eum: Domine, doce nos orare, sicut et Joannes docuit discipulos suos.
verses.english: One day, after Jesus had finished praying, one of His disciples said to Him, “Lord, teach us how to pray, just as John taught his disciples.”

verses.latin: Et ait illis: Cum oratis, dicite: Pater, sanctificetur nomen tuum. Adveniat regnum tuum.
verses.english: He said to them, “When you pray, say: 'Father, may Your name be kept holy. May Your kingdom come.'

verses.latin: Panem nostrum quotidianum da nobis quotidie.
verses.english: Give us each day the food we need for that day.

verses.latin: Et dimitte nobis peccata nostra: siquidem et nos dimittimus omni debenti nobis. Et ne nos inducas in tentationem.
verses.english: And forgive us our sins, as we too forgive all who are in debt to us. And do not lead us into temptation.”

verses.latin: Et ait ad illos: Quis vestrum habebit amicum, et ibit ad illum media nocte, et dicet illi: Amice, commoda mihi tres panes,
verses.english: Then He said to them, “Suppose one of you has a friend, and you go to him at midnight and say, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,

verses.latin: quia amicus meus venit de via ad me, et non habeo quod ponam illi?
verses.english: because a friend of mine on a journey has come to me, and I have nothing to set before him?’

verses.latin: Et ille de intus respondens dicat: Noli mihi molestus esse, jam ostium clausum est, et pueri mei mecum in cubili sunt: non possum surgere et dare tibi.
verses.english: And he from within will answer, ‘Do not bother me; the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot get up and give you anything.’

verses.latin: Dico vobis, etsi non dabit illi surgens, propter amicitiam, tamen propter importunitatem ejus, surgens dabit illi quotquot habet necessarios.
verses.english: I tell you, even though he will not get up and give him anything because he is his friend, at least because of his persistence he will get up and give him whatever he needs.

verses.latin: Et ego vobis dico: Petite, et dabitur vobis; quaerite, et invenietis; pulsate, et aperietur vobis.
verses.english: So I say to you: Ask, and it will be given to you; search, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened to you.

verses.latin: Omnis enim petens accipit: et quaerens invenit: et pulsanti aperietur.
verses.english: For everyone who asks receives; everyone who searches finds; and for everyone who knocks, the door will be opened.

verses.latin: Quis autem ex vobis patrem petet panem, numquid lapidem dabit illi? aut piscem, numquid pro pisce serpentem dabit illi?
verses.english: What father among you, if his son asks for a loaf of bread, will give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a snake instead of a fish?

verses.latin: Aut si petierit ovum, numquid porriget illi scorpionem?
verses.english: Or if he asks for an egg, will he give him a scorpion?

verses.latin: Si ergo vos, cum sitis mali, nostis bona data dare filiis vestris: quanto magis Pater vester de coelo dabit spiritum bonum petentibus se?
verses.english: If you then, who are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will the heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask Him!”

verses.latin: Et erat eiciens daemonium, et hoc erat mutum. Cumque eiecisset daemonium, locutus est mutus: et mirati sunt turbæ.
verses.english: Jesus was casting out a demon that was mute. When the demon had gone out, the mute person spoke; and the crowds were amazed.

verses.latin: Quidam autem ex ipsis dixerunt: In Beelzebub principe daemoniorum eicit daemonia.
verses.english: But some of them said, “He casts out demons by Beelzebub, the prince of demons.”

verses.latin: Et alii tentantes, signum de coelo quærebant ab eo.
verses.english: Others, trying to test Him, asked Him for a sign from heaven.

verses.latin: Ipse autem sciens cogitationes eorum, dixit eis: Omne regnum divisum contra se, desolabitur: et domus supra domum cadet.
verses.english: But Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and a house divided against a house will fall.

verses.latin: Si autem Satanas divisus fuerit contra seipsum, quomodo stabit regnum ejus? quia dicitis quod in Beelzebub eicio daemonia.
verses.english: And if Satan is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebub.

verses.latin: Si autem ego in Beelzebub eicio daemonia: filii vestri in quo eiciunt? ideo ipsi judices vestri erunt.
verses.english: Now if I cast out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.

verses.latin: Si vero in digito Dei eicio daemonia: profecto pervenit in vos regnum Dei.
verses.english: But if it is by the finger of God that I cast out demons, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.

verses.latin: Quando fortis armatus custodit atrium suum, in pace sunt ea quæ possidet.
verses.english: When a strong man, fully armed, guards his palace, his goods are in peace.

verses.latin: Si autem fortior eo superveniens vicerit eum, universa arma ejus auferet, in quibus confidebat, et spolia ejus distribuet.
verses.english: But when someone stronger than he attacks him and overpowers him, he takes away his armor in which he trusted and divides his spoils.

verses.latin: Qui non est mecum, contra me est: et qui non colligit mecum, dispergit.
verses.english: Whoever is not with Me is against Me, and whoever does not gather with Me scatters.”

verses.latin: Cum autem immundus spiritus exierit de homine, ambulat per loca arida, quærens requiem: et non inveniens, dicit: Revertar in domum meam unde exivi.
verses.english: When the unclean spirit has gone out of a person, it wanders through arid places looking for rest, and finding none it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’

verses.latin: Et veniens, invenit eam scopis mundatam et ornatam.
verses.english: And when it comes, it finds the house swept and put in order.

verses.latin: Tunc vadit et assumit septem alios spiritus secum, nequiores se, et ingressi habitant ibi: et fiunt novissima hominis illius pejora prioribus.
verses.english: Then it goes and brings seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they enter and live there; and the last state of that person is worse than the first.”

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum hæc diceret, extollens vocem quamdam mulier de turba, dixit illi: Beatus venter qui te portavit, et ubera quæ suxisti.
verses.english: As He was saying these things, a woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to Him, “Blessed is the womb that bore You and the breasts that nursed You!”

verses.latin: At ipse dixit: Quinimo beati, qui audiunt verbum Dei, et custodiunt illud.
verses.english: But He said, “Rather, blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it!”

verses.latin: Turbis autem concurrentibus, coepit dicere: Generatio hæc, generatio mala est: signum quærit, et signum non dabitur ei, nisi signum Jonæ prophetæ.
verses.english: As the crowds were increasing, He began to say, “This generation is an evil generation; it seeks a sign, but no sign will be given to it, except the sign of the prophet Jonah.

verses.latin: Sicut enim Jonas fuit signum Ninivitis, ita erit et Filius hominis generationi huic.
verses.english: For just as Jonah was a sign to the people of Nineveh, so will the Son of Man be to this generation.

verses.latin: Regina Austri surget in judicio cum viris generationis hujus, et condemnabit illos: quia venit a finibus terræ audire sapientiam Salomonis: et ecce plus quam Salomon hic.
verses.english: The queen of the South will rise up at the judgment with the people of this generation and condemn them, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and see, something greater than Solomon is here.

verses.latin: Viri Ninivitæ surgent in judicio cum generatione hac, et condemnabunt eam: quia pœnitentiam egerunt in prædicatione Jonæ: et ecce plus quam Jonas hic.
verses.english: The men of Nineveh will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and see, something greater than Jonah is here.

verses.latin: Nemo autem lucernam accendit, et in condito ponit eam, neque sub modio: sed super candelabrum, ut qui intrant, lumen videant.
verses.english: “No one, when they have lit a lamp, puts it in a cellar or under a basket, but on a lampstand, so that those who enter may see the light.

verses.latin: Lucerna corporis tui oculus est: si oculus tuus fuerit simplex, totum corpus tuum lucidum erit: sin autem nequam fuerit, et corpus tuum tenebrosum erit.
verses.english: The eye is the lamp of the body. When your eye is sound, your whole body is full of light; but when it is bad, your body is full of darkness.

verses.latin: Vide ergo ne lux, quæ in te est, tenebræ sint.
verses.english: Therefore be careful that the light in you is not darkness.

verses.latin: Si ergo totum corpus tuum lucidum fuerit, non habens aliquam partem tenebrarum, erit totum lucidum sicut cum lucerna fulgore suo illuminet te.
verses.english: If then your whole body is full of light, with no part of it in darkness, it will be wholly bright, as when a lamp with its bright shining gives you light.”

verses.latin: Et cum hæc diceret, rogavit illum quidam pharisæus, ut pranderet apud se. Et ingressus, discubuit.
verses.english: While He was speaking, a Pharisee asked Him to dine with him; so He went in and reclined at the table.

verses.latin: Pharisæus autem cœpit mirari, quod non lavisset ante prandium.
verses.english: The Pharisee was surprised to see that He did not wash before dinner.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Dominus ad eum: Nunc vos pharisæi, quod de foris est calicis et catini mundatis: et quod intus est vestrum, plenum est rapina et nequitia.
verses.english: And the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the dish, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.

verses.latin: Stulti: nonne qui fecit quod de foris est, ipsum quoque fecit quod intus est?
verses.english: You fools! Did not the One who made the outside make the inside also?

verses.latin: Verumtamen quod superest, date eleemosynam, et ecce omnia munda sunt vobis.
verses.english: But give as charity the things that are within, and then all things will be clean for you.

verses.latin: Sed væ vobis pharisæis, quia decimatis mentam, et rutam, et omne olus, et præteritis judicium et caritatem Dei: hæc oportuit facere, et illa non omittere.
verses.english: “But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and every herb, and you ignore justice and the love of God; these things you should have done, without neglecting the others.

verses.latin: Væ vobis pharisæis, quia diligitis primas cathedras in synagogis, et salutationes in foro.
verses.english: Woe to you Pharisees! For you love the best seats in the synagogues and greetings in the marketplaces.

verses.latin: Væ vobis, quia estis ut sepulchra, quæ non parent, et homines ambulantes nescientes.
verses.english: Woe to you! For you are like unmarked graves, and people walk over them without knowing it.”

verses.latin: Respondens autem quidam ex legisperitis, ait illi: Magister, hæc dicens, contumeliam nobis facis.
verses.english: Then one of the lawyers answered Him, “Teacher, in saying these things You insult us too.”

verses.latin: Ipse autem dixit: Et vobis legisperitis væ, quia oneratis homines onera importabilia, et ipsi uno digito non tangitis sarcinas.
verses.english: And He said, “Woe to you lawyers also! For you load people with burdens hard to bear, and you yourselves do not touch the burdens with one of your fingers.

verses.latin: Væ vobis, quia ædificatis monumenta prophetarum: patres autem vestri occiderunt illos.
verses.english: Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets whom your ancestors killed.

verses.latin: Profecto testimonium estis quod consentitis operibus patrum vestrorum: quia ipsi quidem occiderunt illos, vos autem ædificatis eorum monumenta.
verses.english: So you are witnesses and you approve the deeds of your ancestors, because they killed the prophets and you build their tombs.

verses.latin: Ideo et sapientia Dei dixit: Mittam ad illos prophetas et apostolos, et ex illis occident et persequentur,
verses.english: Therefore also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles, and some of them they will kill and persecute,’

verses.latin: ut inquiratur a generatione hac sanguis omnium prophetarum, qui effusus est a constitutione mundi,
verses.english: so that the blood of all the prophets, shed since the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation,

verses.latin: a sanguine Abel usque ad sanguinem Zachariæ, qui periit inter altare et templum. Ita, dico vobis, requiretur ab hac generatione.
verses.english: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who perished between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, it will be required of this generation.

verses.latin: Væ vobis legisperitis, quia tulistis clavem scientiæ: ipsi non introistis, et introeuntes prohibuistis.
verses.english: “Woe to you lawyers! For you have taken away the key of knowledge; you did not enter yourselves, and those who were entering you hindered.”

verses.latin: Cum autem egrederetur inde, cœperunt pharisæi et scribæ graviter insistere, et eum vehementer opprimere, et de multis quæstionibus insidiantes ei,
verses.english: As He went away from there, the scribes and the Pharisees began to press Him hard and to provoke Him to speak about many things,

verses.latin: quærentes aliquid capere de ore ejus.
verses.english: seeking to catch Him in something He might say.

verses.latin: Interea cum turbæ innumerabiles convenissent, ita ut conculcarent se invicem, cœpit Jesus dicere ad discipulos suos: Attendite a fermento pharisæorum, quod est hypocrisis.
verses.english: Meanwhile, when many thousands of people gathered together, crushing each other, Jesus began to speak to His disciples, saying: "Be careful of the hypocrisy of the Pharisees!"

verses.latin: Nihil autem opertum est, quod non revelabitur: neque absconditum, quod non scietur.
verses.english: For there is nothing hidden that will not be revealed, nor is there anything secret that will not be known.

verses.latin: Quoniam quæ in tenebris dixistis, in lumine dicentur: et quod in aure dixistis in cubiculum, prædicabitur in tectis.
verses.english: Therefore, whatever you speak in darkness will be spoken in the light, and what you have whispered in the ear in the inner rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.

verses.latin: Dico autem vobis amicis meis: Ne terreamini ab his qui occidunt corpus, et post hæc non habent amplius quid facere.
verses.english: I say to you, my friends: Don't be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that, they cannot do anything more.

verses.latin: Ostendam autem vobis quem timeatis: timete eum qui postquam occiderit, potest mittere in gehennam: ita dico vobis, hunc timete.
verses.english: I will show you whom you should fear: fear the One who, after killing, has the power to cast into hell. Yes, I tell you, fear Him.

verses.latin: Nonne quinque passeres venundantur dipendio? et unus ex illis non est in oblivione coram Deo.
verses.english: Are not five sparrows sold for two coins? Yet not one of them is forgotten by God.

verses.latin: Sed et capilli capitis vestri omnes numerati sunt. Nolite timere: multis passeribus pluris estis.
verses.english: Indeed, the very hairs of your head are all numbered. So do not be afraid; you are of more value than many sparrows.

verses.latin: Dico autem vobis: Omnis quicumque confitebitur me coram hominibus, confitebitur et Filius hominis illum coram angelis Dei.
verses.english: I tell you: Whoever acknowledges Me before men, the Son of Man will also acknowledge him before the angels of God.

verses.latin: Qui autem negaverit me coram hominibus, negabitur coram angelis Dei.
verses.english: But whoever disowns Me before men will be disowned before the angels of God.

verses.latin: Et omnis qui dicit verbum in Filium hominis, remittetur ei: ei autem qui in Spiritum Sanctum blasphemaverit, non remittetur.
verses.english: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven; but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.

verses.latin: Cum autem introduxerint vos in synagogas, et magistratus, et potestates, nolite solliciti esse qualiter aut quid respondeatis, aut quid dicatis:
verses.english: When they bring you before synagogues, rulers, and authorities, do not worry about how or what you should respond or what you should say,

verses.latin: Spiritus enim Sanctus docebit vos in ipsa hora quid oporteat dicere.
verses.english: For the Holy Spirit will teach you at that very hour what you ought to say.

verses.latin: Ait autem illi quidam de turba: Magister, dic fratri meo ut dividat mecum hæreditatem.
verses.english: Then someone from the crowd said to Him: "Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me."

verses.latin: At ille dixit ei: Homo, quis me constituit judicem, aut divisorem super vos?
verses.english: Jesus replied to him: "Man, who appointed Me a judge or divider over you?"

verses.latin: Ait autem ad illos: Videte, et cavete ab avaritia: quia non in abundantia cujusquam vita ejus est ex his quæ possidet.
verses.english: And He said to them, "Watch out! Be on your guard against all kinds of greed, for a man's life does not consist in the abundance of his possessions."

verses.latin: Dixit autem parabolam ad illos, dicens: Hominis cujusdam divitis agri fructus afferebat abundanter:
verses.english: Then He told them a parable: "The land of a rich man produced an abundant crop.

verses.latin: et cogitabat intra se dicens: Quid faciam, quia non habeo quo congregem fructus meos?
verses.english: And he thought to himself, 'What shall I do? I have no place to store my crops.'

verses.latin: Et dixit: Hoc faciam: destruam horrea mea, et majora faciam, et congregabo illic omnia quæ mihi fructus nascitur, et bona mea:
verses.english: And he said, 'This is what I will do. I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.'

verses.latin: et dicam animæ meæ: Anima, habes multa bona reposita in multos annos: requiesce, comede, bibe, epulare.
verses.english: And I will say to myself, 'You have many good things stored up for many years. Relax, eat, drink, and be merry.'

verses.latin: Dixit autem illi Deus: Stulte, hac nocte animam tuam repetunt a te: quæ autem parasti, cujus erunt?
verses.english: But God said to him, 'You fool! This night your soul is required of you; then whose will those things be which you have provided?'

verses.latin: Sic est qui sibi thesaurizat, et non est in Deum dives.
verses.english: So is the man who lays up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God."

verses.latin: Dixit autem ad discipulos suos: Ideo dico vobis, nolite solliciti esse animæ vestræ quid edatis, neque corpori vestro quid vestiamini.
verses.english: And He said to His disciples, "Therefore I say to you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat; nor about your body, what you will put on.

verses.latin: Anima enim plus est quam esca, et corpus plus est quam vestimentum.
verses.english: For life is more than food, and the body more than clothing.

verses.latin: Considerate corvos, quia non seminant, neque metunt, quibus non est cellarium neque horreum, et Deus pascit illos: quanto magis vos pluris estis illis?
verses.english: Consider the ravens, for they neither sow nor reap, who have neither storehouse nor barn; and God feeds them. How much more are you better than the birds?

verses.latin: Quis autem vestrum cogitando potest adjicere ad staturam suam cubitum unum?
verses.english: And which of you by worrying can add a single cubit to his stature?

verses.latin: Si ergo neque quod minimum est potestis, quid de ceteris solliciti estis?
verses.english: If you cannot do the least, why are you anxious about the rest?

verses.latin: Considerate lilia quomodo crescunt: non laborant, neque nent. Dico autem vobis, nec Salomon in omni gloria sua coopertus est sicut unum ex istis.
verses.english: Consider the lilies, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin, but I tell you that not even Solomon in all his glory was clothed like one of these.

verses.latin: Si autem fœnum in agro hodie est, et cras in clibanum mittitur, Deus sic vestit: quanto magis vos pusillanimes?
verses.english: Now if God so clothes the grass in the field, which today is, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, how much more will He clothe you, O you of little faith?

verses.latin: Et vos nolite quærere quid manducetis, aut quid bibatis: et nolite suspendi.
verses.english: And do not seek what you should eat or what you should drink, nor be anxious.

verses.latin: Hæc enim omnia gentes mundi quærunt. Pater autem vester scit quia his indigetis.
verses.english: For all these things the nations of the world seek after, and your Father knows that you need these things.

verses.latin: Verumtamen quærite primum regnum Dei et justitiam ejus, et hæc omnia adjicientur vobis.
verses.english: But seek the kingdom of God, and all these things will be added to you.

verses.latin: Nolite timere pusillus grex, quia placuit Patri vestro dare vobis regnum.
verses.english: Do not fear, little flock, for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.

verses.latin: Vendite quæ possidetis, et date eleemosynam. Facite vobis sacculos, qui non veterascunt, thesaurum non deficientem in cœlis: ubi fur non appropriat, neque tinea corrumpit.
verses.english: Sell what you have and give alms; make yourselves purses which do not wear out, an unfailing treasure in heaven, where no thief comes near, nor moth destroys.

verses.latin: Ubi enim thesaurus vester est, ibi et cor vestrum est.
verses.english: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.

verses.latin: Sint lumbi vestri præcincti, et lucernæ ardentes in manibus vestris:
verses.english: Let your loins be girded and your lamps burning;

verses.latin: et vos similes hominibus exspectantibus dominum suum quando revertatur a nuptiis: ut cum venerit et pulsaverit, continuo aperiant ei.
verses.english: and you yourselves be like men who wait for their master to return from the wedding feast, so that when he comes and knocks, they may immediately open to him.

verses.latin: Beati servi illi, quos cum venerit dominus, invenerit vigilantes. Amen dico vobis, quod præcinct se, et faciet illos discumbere, et transiens ministrabit illis.
verses.english: Blessed are those servants whom the master finds awake when he comes! Truly, I say to you, he will gird himself and have them recline at table, and he will come and serve them.

verses.latin: Et si venerit in secunda vigilia, et si in tertia vigilia venerit, et ita invenerit, beati sunt illi servi.
verses.english: If he comes in the second watch, or if he comes in the third watch, and finds them awake, blessed are those servants!

verses.latin: Hoc autem scitote, quoniam si sciret paterfamilias qua hora fur venturus esset, vigilaret utique, et non sineret perfodi domum suam.
verses.english: But understand this: If the master of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would have kept watch and would not have allowed his house to be broken into.

verses.latin: Et vos estote parati: quia qua hora non putatis, Filius hominis veniet.
verses.english: You also must be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect.

verses.latin: Ait autem illi Petrus: Domine, ad nos dicis hanc parabolam, an et ad omnes?
verses.english: Peter said to Him: "Lord, are You telling this parable to us, or to everyone?"

verses.latin: Dixit autem Dominus: Quis putas est fidelis dispensator, et prudens, quem constituet dominus super familiam suam, ut det illis in tempore tritici mensuram?
verses.english: And the Lord said: "Who then is the faithful and prudent steward whom his master will put in charge of his servants to give them their portion of food at the proper time?

verses.latin: Beatus ille servus, quem cum venerit dominus ejus, invenerit ita facientem.
verses.english: Blessed is that servant whom his master will find doing so when he comes.

verses.latin: Vere dico vobis, quia super omnia quæ possidet, constituet eum.
verses.english: Truly, I say to you, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.

verses.latin: Quod si dixerit servus ille in corde suo: Moram facit dominus meus venire: et cœperit percutere servos et ancillas, et edere et bibere, et inebriari:
verses.english: But if that servant says in his heart, 'My master is delaying his coming,' and begins to beat the male and female servants, and to eat and drink and get drunk,

verses.latin: veniet dominus servi illius in die qua non sperat, et hora qua nescit, et dividet eum, partemque ejus cum infidelibus ponet.
verses.english: the master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he does not know, and will cut him in two and assign him a place with the unfaithful.

verses.latin: Ille autem servus, qui cognovit voluntatem domini sui, et non præparavit, et non fecit secundum voluntatem ejus, vapulabit multis plagis.
verses.english: And that servant who knew his master's will and did not prepare or do what was required of him will be beaten with many blows.

verses.latin: Qui autem nesciens, fecit dignus plagis, vapulabit paucis. Omnis autem cui multum datum est, multum quæretur ab eo: et cui commendaverunt multum, plus petent ab eo.
verses.english: But the one who did not know, and did what deserved a beating, will receive a few blows. To whom much is given, much will be required, and from the one to whom much has been entrusted, even more will be demanded.

verses.latin: Ignem veni mittere in terram: et quid volo nisi ut accendatur?
verses.english: I came to cast fire on the earth, and would that it were already kindled!

verses.latin: Baptismate autem habeo baptizari: et quomodo coarctor usque dum perficiatur?
verses.english: But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how I am constrained until it is completed!

verses.latin: Putatis quia pacem veni mittere in terram? Non dico vobis, sed separationem.
verses.english: Do you think that I have come to bring peace on earth? No, I tell you, but division.

verses.latin: Erunt enim ex hoc quinque in domo una divisi: tres in duos, et duo in tres dividentur.
verses.english: For from now on in one house there will be five divided, three against two, and two against three.

verses.latin: Dividetur pater in filium, et filius in patrem suum: mater in filiam, et filia in matrem suam: socrus in nurum suam, et nurus in socrum suam.
verses.english: They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.

verses.latin: Dicebat autem ad turbas: Cum videritis nubem orientem ab occidente, statim dicitis: Nimbus venit: et ita fit.
verses.english: He also said to the crowds, "When you see a cloud rising in the west, immediately you say, 'A shower is coming,' and so it happens.

verses.latin: Et cum austrum flantem videritis, dicitis: Quia æstus erit: et fit.
verses.english: And when you see the south wind blowing, you say, 'There will be scorching heat,' and it happens.

verses.latin: Hypocritæ, faciem cæli et terræ nostis probare: tempus autem hoc, quomodo non probatis?
verses.english: You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, but why do you not know how to interpret the present time?

verses.latin: Et quare non de vobis ipsis judicatis quod justum est?
verses.english: And why do you not judge for yourselves what is right?

verses.latin: Cum enim vadis cum adversario tuo ad principem, in via da operam liberari ab eo: ne forte trahat te ad judicem, et judex tradat te exactori, et exactor te mittat in carcerem.
verses.english: When you go with your accuser before a magistrate, make an effort to settle with him on the way, lest he drag you to the judge, and the judge hand you over to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.

verses.latin: Dico tibi, non exies inde, donec etiam minimum quadrantem persolvas.
verses.english: I tell you, you will not get out until you have paid the very last penny.

verses.latin: Erant autem in ipso tempore, adferentes ei de Galilaeis, quorum sanguinem Pilatus miscuerat cum sacrificiis eorum.
verses.english: At that time, some people told Jesus about some Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.

verses.latin: Et respondens, dixit illis: Putatis quod hi Galilaei prae omnibus Galilaeis peccatores fuerunt, quia talia passi sunt?
verses.english: And He answered, "Do you think that these Galileans were greater sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered these things?

verses.latin: Non, dico vobis: sed nisi poenitentiam egeritis, omnes similiter peribitis.
verses.english: I tell you, no; but unless you do penance, you will all perish in the same way.

verses.latin: Vel illi decem et octo, supra quos ceciderunt turris in Siloe, putatis quia et ipsi debitores fuerunt prae omnibus hominibus qui habitant in Jerusalem?
verses.english: Or those eighteen on whom the tower in Siloam fell—do you think that they were debtors above all the people who live in Jerusalem?

verses.latin: Non, dico vobis: sed nisi poenitentiam egeritis, omnes similiter peribitis.
verses.english: I tell you, no; but unless you do penance, you will all perish in the same way.

verses.latin: Dicebat autem hanc similitudinem: Arborem ficus habebat quidam in vinea sua, et venit quaerens fructum in illa, et non invenit.
verses.english: He spoke also this parable: "A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard; and he came looking for fruit on it and found none.

verses.latin: Dixit autem ad cultorem vineae: Ecce anni tres sunt ex quo venio quaerens fructum in fico hoc, et non invenio: succide ergo illam: ut quid etiam terram occupat?
verses.english: He said to the vinedresser, 'Behold, for three years I have come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and I find none. Cut it down. Why does it still occupy the ground?'

verses.latin: At ille respondens, dicit illi: Domine, dimitte illam et hoc anno, usque dum fodiam circa illam, et mittam stercora:
verses.english: But he answering, said to him, 'Lord, let it alone this year also, until I dig around it and put on manure.

verses.latin: si forte fecerit fructum: sin autem, in futurum succides eam.
verses.english: And if it bears fruit, well; but if not, then after that you can cut it down.'

verses.latin: Erat autem docens in una sabbati in synagogis.
verses.english: And He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.

verses.latin: Et ecce mulier, quae habebat spiritum infirmitatis annis decem et octo: et erat incurvata, nec omnino poterat sursum aspicere.
verses.english: And behold, there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity for eighteen years; and she was bent over and could not in any way look up.

verses.latin: Quam cum vidisset Jesus, vocavit eam, et dixit illi: Mulier, dimissa es a infirmitate tua.
