verses.english: And He said to them, “Behold, when you enter the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him into the house which he enters.

verses.latin: Et dicetis patrifamilias domus: Magister dicit tibi: Ubi est diversorium, ubi Pascha cum discipulis meis manducem?
verses.english: And you shall say to the master of the house: ‘The Master says to you: Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?’

verses.latin: Et ipse ostendet vobis cenaculum magnum stratum: et ibi parate.
verses.english: And he will show you a large upper room furnished. Prepare it there.”

verses.latin: Euntes autem invenerunt sicut dixit illis: et paraverunt Pascha.
verses.english: And they went, and they found as He had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.

verses.latin: Et cum hora venisset, discubuit, et duodecim Apostoli cum eo.
verses.english: And when the hour came, He reclined at table, and the twelve Apostles with Him.

verses.latin: Et ait illis: Desiderio desideravi hoc Pascha manducare vobiscum, antequam patiar.
verses.english: And He said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.

verses.latin: Dico enim vobis, quod ex hoc non manducabo illud, donec impleatur in regno Dei.
verses.english: For I tell you that I will not eat it again until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”

verses.latin: Et accepto calice, gratias egit, et dixit: Accipite, et dividite inter vos:
verses.english: And taking a chalice, He gave thanks and said, “Take this, and divide it among yourselves.

verses.latin: Dico enim vobis, quod non bibam de generatione vitis, donec regnum Dei veniat.
verses.english: For I tell you that I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”

verses.latin: Et accepta panem, gratias egit, et fregit, et dedit eis, dicens: Hoc est corpus meum, quod pro vobis datur: hoc facite in meam commemorationem.
verses.english: And taking bread, He gave thanks, and broke it, and gave it to them, saying, “This is My body, which is given for you. Do this in remembrance of Me.”

verses.latin: Similiter et calicem, postquam cenavit, dicens: Hic est calix novum testamentum in meo sanguine, qui pro vobis fundetur.
verses.english: Likewise also the chalice, after supper, saying: “This is the chalice, the new testament in My blood, which will be poured out for you.”

verses.latin: Verumtamen ecce manus tradentis me, cum me, in mensa.
verses.english: Yet behold, the hand of the one betraying Me is with Me at the table.

verses.latin: Et quidem Filius hominis, secundum quod definitum est, vadit: verumtamen væ homini illi per quem tradetur.
verses.english: And truly the Son of Man goes according to what is determined, but woe to that man by whom He is betrayed!”

verses.latin: Et illi cœperunt quærere inter se, quisnam esset qui hoc facturus esset.
verses.english: And they began to inquire among themselves who it was that would do this.

verses.latin: Facta est autem et contentio inter eos, quis eorum videretur esse major.
verses.english: And there was also a strife among them, which of them should seem to be the greater.

verses.latin: Ipse autem dixit eis: Reges gentium dominantur eorum: et qui potestatem habent super eos, benefici vocantur.
verses.english: But He said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those who have power over them are called benefactors.

verses.latin: Vos autem non sic: sed qui major est in vobis, fiat sicut minor: et qui præcessor est, sicut ministrator.
verses.english: But not so with you. Instead, let the one who is greatest among you become as the least, and the leader as the one who serves.

verses.latin: Nam quis major est, qui recumbit, an qui ministrat? nonne qui recumbit? ego autem in medio vestrum sum sicut qui ministrat.
verses.english: For who is greater, the one who reclines or the one who serves? Is it not the one who reclines? But I am in your midst as one who serves.

verses.latin: Vos autem estis qui permansistis mecum in tentationibus meis:
verses.english: You are those who have remained with Me in My trials.

verses.latin: et ego dispono vobis sicut disposuit mihi Pater meus regnum,
verses.english: And I appoint to you, as My Father has appointed to Me, a kingdom,

verses.latin: ut edatis et bibatis super mensam meam in regno meo: et sedeatis super thronos, judicantes duodecim tribus Israël.
verses.english: that you may eat and drink at My table in My kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”

verses.latin: Simon, Simon, ecce Satanas expetivit vos ut cribraret sicut triticum:
verses.english: And the Lord said, “Simon, Simon, behold, Satan has demanded to sift you like wheat.

verses.latin: ego autem rogavi pro te, ut non deficiat fides tua: et tu aliquando conversus, confirma fratres tuos.
verses.english: But I have prayed for you, that your faith may not fail. And when you have turned again, strengthen your brothers.”

verses.latin: Qui dixit ei: Domine, paratus sum tecum et in carcerem et in mortem ire.
verses.english: He said to Him, “Lord, I am ready to go with You both to prison and to death.”

verses.latin: At ille dixit: Dico tibi, Petre, non cantabit hodie gallus, donec ter neges te nosse me.
verses.english: But He said, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will not crow today until you have denied Me three times that you know Me.”

verses.latin: Et dixit illis: Quando misi vos sine sacco, et pera, et calceamentis, numquid aliquid defuit vobis?
verses.english: And He said to them, “When I sent you without a purse or a bag or sandals, did you lack anything?”

verses.latin: At illi dixerunt: Nihil. Dixit ergo eis: Sed nunc, qui habet sacculum, tollat: similiter et peram: et qui non habet, vendat tunicam suam, et emat gladium.
verses.english: They said, “Nothing.” Then He said to them, “But now, let the one who has a purse take it, and likewise a bag, and let the one who has no sword sell his cloak and buy one.

verses.latin: Dico enim vobis, quod hæc, quæ scripta sunt, oportet adhuc impleri in me: Et cum iniquis reputatus est. Nam ea, quæ sunt de me, finem habent.
verses.english: For I tell you that this which is written must still be fulfilled in Me: ‘And He was reckoned with the lawless.’ For those things concerning Me have an end.”

verses.latin: At illi dixerunt: Domine, ecce duo gladii hic. Qui dixit eis: Satis est.
verses.english: And they said, “Lord, behold, here are two swords.” And He said to them, “It is enough.”

verses.latin: Et egressus, ibat secundum consuetudinem in monte Oliveti: sequebantur autem illum et discipuli.
verses.english: And going out, He went as was His custom to the Mount of Olives; and the disciples also followed Him.

verses.latin: Et cum pervenisset in locum, dixit illis: Orate ne intretis in tentationem.
verses.english: And when He arrived at the place, He said to them, “Pray that you may not enter into temptation.”

verses.latin: Et ipse avulsus est ab eis quantum jactus lapidis: et positis genibus, orabat,
verses.english: And He withdrew from them about a stone’s throw; and He knelt down and prayed,

verses.latin: dicens: Pater, si vis, transfer calicem istum a me: verumtamen non mea voluntas, sed tua fiat.
verses.english: saying, “Father, if You are willing, remove this chalice from Me. But not My will, but Yours, be done.”

verses.latin: Apparuit autem illi angelus de cœlo, confortans eum.
verses.english: And there appeared to Him an angel from heaven, strengthening Him.

verses.latin: Et factus in agonia, prolixius orabat. Et factus est sudor ejus sicut guttæ sanguinis decurrentis in terram.
verses.english: And being in agony, He prayed more earnestly. And His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down to the ground.

verses.latin: Et cum surrexisset a oratione, et venisset ad discipulos suos, invenit eos dormientes præ tristitia.
verses.english: And when He arose from prayer, and had come to His disciples, He found them sleeping for sorrow.

verses.latin: Et dixit illis: Quid dormitis? surgite, orate, ne intretis in tentationem.
verses.english: And He said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Rise and pray that you may not enter into temptation.”

verses.latin: Adhuc eo loquente, ecce turba: et qui vocabatur Judas, unus de duodecim, præcedebat eos, et appropinquavit Jesu ut oscularetur eum.
verses.english: While He was still speaking, behold, a crowd came up, and the one called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them, and approached Jesus to kiss Him.

verses.latin: Jesus autem dixit illi: Juda, osculo Filium hominis tradis?
verses.english: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?”

verses.latin: Videntes autem qui cum eo erant, quod futurum erat, dixerunt ei: Domine, si percutimus in gladio?
verses.english: When those who were with Him saw what was going to happen, they said to Him, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”

verses.latin: Et percussit unus ex illis servum principis sacerdotum, et amputavit auriculam ejus.
verses.english: And one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear.

verses.latin: Respondens autem Jesus, dixit: Sinite usque huc. Et cum tetigisset auriculam ejus, sanavit eum.
verses.english: But Jesus answered and said, “Stop! No more of this.” And He touched his ear and healed him.

verses.latin: Dixit autem ad eos, qui venerant ad se, principes sacerdotum, et magistratus templi, et seniores: Quasi ad latronem existis cum gladiis et fustibus?
verses.english: Then Jesus said to those who had come out to Him, the chief priests, and captains of the temple, and the elders, “Have you come out as against a robber, with swords and clubs?

verses.latin: Cum quotidie vobiscum eram in templo, non extendistis in me manus: sed hæc est hora vestra, et potestas tenebrarum.
verses.english: When I was daily with you in the temple, you did not stretch out your hands against Me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness.”

verses.latin: Comprehendentes autem eum, duxerunt eum, et introduxerunt in domum pontificis. Petrus autem sequebatur a longe.
verses.english: Then, taking Him, they led Him away and brought Him into the high priest’s house. But Peter was following at a distance.

verses.latin: Accenso autem igne in medio atrii, et simul sedentibus, erat Petrus inter eos.
verses.english: And when they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and were sitting together, Peter was in the midst of them.

verses.latin: Videns autem illum ancilla quædam sedentem ad lumen, et inhiens in eum, dixit: Et hic cum illo erat.
verses.english: But when a certain servant girl saw him sitting near the light, and looking closely at him, she said, “This man was also with Him.”

verses.latin: At ille negavit eum, dicens: Mulier, non novi eum.
verses.english: But he denied Him, saying, “Woman, I do not know Him.”

verses.latin: Et post pusillum, alius videns eum, dixit: Et tu de illis es. Petrus vero ait: Homo, non sum.
verses.english: And after a little while, another one seeing him said, “You are also one of them.” But Peter said, “Man, I am not.”

verses.latin: Et intervallo facto quasi horæ unius, alius quidam confirmabat, dicens: Vere et hic cum illo erat: nam et Galilæus est.
verses.english: And after about an hour had passed, another one was insisting, saying, “Truly, this man also was with Him, for he is also a Galilean.”

verses.latin: Ait autem Petrus: Homo, nescio quid dicis. Et continuo, adhuc illo loquente, cantavit gallus.
verses.english: But Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are saying.” And immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.

verses.latin: Et conversus Dominus respexit Petrum. Et recordatus est Petrus verbi Domini, sicut dixit ei: Quia priusquam gallus cantet, ter me negabis.
verses.english: And the Lord turned and looked at Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how He had said to him, “Before a rooster crows today, you will deny Me three times.”

verses.latin: Et egressus foras Petrus, flevit amare.
verses.english: And Peter went out and wept bitterly.

verses.latin: Et viri, qui tenebant illum, illudebant ei, cædentes.
verses.english: And the men who were holding Him mocked Him, beating Him.

verses.latin: Et velaverant eum, et percutiebant faciem ejus: et interrogabant eum, dicentes: Prophetiza, quis est qui te percussit?
verses.english: And they blindfolded Him, and struck His face, and were questioning Him, saying, “Prophesy, who is the one who struck you?”

verses.latin: Et alia multa blasphemantes dicebant in eum.
verses.english: And they were saying many other blasphemies against Him.

verses.latin: Et ut factus est dies, convenerunt seniores plebis, et principes sacerdotum, et scribæ, et duxerunt eum in concilium suum,
verses.english: And as soon as it was day, the elders of the people assembled, along with the chief priests and scribes, and they led Him into their council,

verses.latin: dicentes: Si tu es Christus, dic nobis.
verses.english: saying, “If You are the Christ, tell us.”

verses.latin: Et dixit eis: Si vobis dixero, non creditis mihi:
verses.english: But He said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe Me,

verses.latin: Si autem et interrogavero vos, non respondebitis mihi, neque dimittetis.
verses.english: and if I also ask you, you will not answer Me, nor will you let Me go.

verses.latin: Ex hoc autem erit Filius hominis sedens a dextris virtutis Dei.
verses.english: But from now on the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”

verses.latin: Dixerunt autem omnes: Tu ergo es Filius Dei? Qui ait: Vos dicitis quia ego sum.
verses.english: They all said, “Are You then the Son of God?” He said to them, “You say that I am.”

verses.latin: At illi dixerunt: Quid adhuc desideramus testimonium? ipsi enim audivimus de ore ipsius.
verses.english: And they said, “What further need do we have of testimony? For we have heard it ourselves from His own mouth.”

verses.latin: Et surgens omnis multitudo eorum, duxerunt eum ad Pilatum.
verses.english: And the entire crowd rose and led Him to Pilate.

verses.latin: Coeperunt autem accusare eum, dicentes: Hunc invenimus subvertentem gentem nostram, et prohibentem tributa dari Cæsari, et dicentem se Christum regem esse.
verses.english: They began to accuse Him, saying, “We found this man subverting our nation, forbidding taxes to be paid to Caesar, and claiming to be Christ the King.”

verses.latin: Pilatus autem interrogavit eum, dicens: Tu es rex Judæorum? At ille respondens, ait: Tu dicis.
verses.english: Pilate questioned Him, saying, “Are you the King of the Jews?” Jesus answered, “You say so.”

verses.latin: Dixit autem Pilatus ad principes sacerdotum, et ad turbas: Nihil invenio in hoc homine causæ.
verses.english: Pilate then said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I find no crime in this man.”

verses.latin: At illi instabant, dicentes: Commovet populum, docens per universam Judæam, incipiens a Galilæa usque huc.
verses.english: But they insisted, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee to this place.”

verses.latin: Pilatus autem audiens Galilæam, interrogavit si homo Galilæus esset.
verses.english: When Pilate heard Galilee mentioned, he asked if the man was a Galilean.

verses.latin: Et ut cognovit quod de potestate Herodis esset, remisit eum ad Herodem, qui et ipse erat in Ierusalem illis diebus.
verses.english: And when he learned that Jesus was under Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent Him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem during those days.

verses.latin: Herodes autem, viso Jesu, gavisus est valde: erat enim cupiens ex multo tempore videre faciem ejus, propter quod audiebat multa de eo, et sperabat signum aliquod videre fieri ab eo.
verses.english: Herod, upon seeing Jesus, was greatly pleased. For he had long desired to see Him, because he had heard many things about Him, and he hoped to see some miracle performed by Him.

verses.latin: Interrogabat autem eum multis sermonibus: at ipse nihil illi respondebat.
verses.english: He questioned Him at length, but Jesus gave him no answer.

verses.latin: Stabant autem principes sacerdotum et scribæ constanter accusantes eum.
verses.english: Meanwhile, the chief priests and the scribes stood by, vehemently accusing Him.

verses.latin: Sprevit autem illum Herodes cum exercitu suo: et inlusit, et vestem candidam circumdedit ei, et remisit ad Pilatum.
verses.english: Herod, along with his soldiers, scorned and mocked Jesus. He dressed Him in a white robe and sent Him back to Pilate.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt amici Herodes et Pilatus in ipsa die: nam antea inimici erant inter se.
verses.english: And on that day, Herod and Pilate became friends, for they had been enemies before.

verses.latin: Pilatus autem, convocatis principibus sacerdotum, et magistratibus, et plebe,
verses.english: Pilate, having called together the chief priests, the magistrates, and the people,

verses.latin: dixit ad illos: Obtulistis mihi hunc hominem, quasi avertentem populum: et ecce ego coram vobis interrogans, nullam causam inveni in homine isto ex his in quibus eum accusatis.
verses.english: said to them, “You have brought this man to me as one who perverts the people. Behold, I have examined Him before you and have found in this man no cause for the accusations you bring against Him.

verses.latin: Sed neque Herodes: nam et remisi vos ad illum, et ecce nihil dignum morte actum est ei.
verses.english: Neither has Herod, for I sent you to him, and behold, nothing deserving death has been done by Him.

verses.latin: Emendabo itaque eum, et dimittam.
verses.english: Therefore, I will chastise Him and release Him.”

verses.latin: Necessario autem habebat dimittere illis per festum unum.
verses.english: Now, he was obliged to release one prisoner to them at the feast.

verses.latin: Unus autem clamavit universa multitudo eorum, dicens: Toll hunc, et dimitte nobis Barabbam:
verses.english: Then the whole crowd cried out together, saying, “Away with this man, and release Barabbas to us:

verses.latin: qui propter seditionem quam fecit in civitate, et homicidium missus erat in carcerem.
verses.english: Barabbas, who had been imprisoned for a riot that occurred in the city, and for murder.

verses.latin: Iterum autem Pilatus conatus est dimittere Jesum.
verses.english: Pilate, wanting to release Jesus, addressed them again,

verses.latin: Sed illi succinebant, dicentes: Crucifige, crucifige eum.
verses.english: But they kept shouting, “Crucify Him! Crucify Him!”

verses.latin: Tertio autem ille dixit ad illos: Quid enim mali fecit iste? Nullam causam mortis invenio in eo: corripiam ergo illum, et dimittam.
verses.english: Pilate addressed them a third time: “Why? What evil has He done? I find no cause of death in Him. Therefore, I will chastise Him and release Him.”

verses.latin: At illi instabant vocibus magnis, postulantes ut crucifigeretur: et increpabant vocibus eorum, et principum sacerdotum.
verses.english: But they persisted, demanding with loud voices that He be crucified. And their voices and those of the chief priests prevailed.

verses.latin: Et Pilatus judicavit fieri petitionem eorum.
verses.english: So Pilate gave his decision that their demand should be granted.

verses.latin: Dimisit itaque illis eum, qui propter seditionem et homicidium missus fuerat in carcerem, quem petebant: Jesum autem tradidit voluntati eorum.
verses.english: He released the man who was imprisoned for sedition and murder, the one they had asked for, but he handed Jesus over to their will.

verses.latin: Et cum ducerent eum, apprehenderunt Simonem Cyrenæum venientem de villa: et imposuerunt illi crucem portare post Jesum.
verses.english: As they led Him away, they seized Simon of Cyrene, who was coming in from the country, and they laid the cross on him to carry behind Jesus.

verses.latin: Sequebatur autem illum magna multitudo populi, et mulierum, quæ plangebant eum, et flebant.
verses.english: A great crowd of people and women followed Him, and they were mourning and lamenting Him.

verses.latin: Conversus autem ad illas Jesus, dixit: Filiæ Jerusalem, nolite flere super me: sed super vos ipsas flete, et super filios vestros.
verses.english: But turning to them, Jesus said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for Me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.

verses.latin: Quia ecce venient dies in quibus dicent: Beati steriles, et ventres qui non genuerunt, et ubera quæ non lactaverunt.
verses.english: For behold, the days are coming when they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren and the wombs that never bore and the breasts that never nursed.’

verses.latin: Tunc incipient dicere montibus: Cadite super nos; et collibus: Operite nos.
verses.english: Then they will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us,’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us.’

verses.latin: Quia si in viridi ligno hæc faciunt, quid in arido fiet?
verses.english: For if they do these things when the wood is green, what will happen when it is dry?”

verses.latin: Ducebantur autem et alii duo mali cum illo, ut interficerentur.
verses.english: Two others, both criminals, were also being led away to be executed with Him.

verses.latin: Et postquam venerunt in locum qui vocatur Calvariæ, ibi crucifixerunt eum: et maleficentes, unum a dextris, et alterum a sinistris.
verses.english: When they came to the place called The Skull, there they crucified Him, and also the criminals, one on His right and the other on His left.

verses.latin: Et Jesus dicebat: Pater, dimitte illis: non enim sciunt quid faciunt. Dividentes autem vestimenta ejus, miserunt sortes.
verses.english: And Jesus was saying, “Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do.” They divided His garments and cast lots.

verses.latin: Et stabat populus spectans, et deridebant eum principes cum illis, dicentes: Alios salvos fecit, seipsum salvum faciat, si hic est Christus Dei electus.
verses.english: And the people stood watching, and the rulers scoffed at Him, saying, “He saved others; let Him save Himself if He is the Christ of God, the chosen one.”

verses.latin: Inludebant autem ei et milites, accedentes, et acetum offerentes ei,
verses.english: The soldiers also mocked Him, coming up to Him and offering Him vinegar,

verses.latin: et dicentes: Si tu es rex Judæorum, salvum te fac.
verses.english: saying, “If you are the King of the Jews, save Yourself.”

verses.latin: Erat autem et titulo inscriptio super eum litteris græcis, et latinis, et hebraicis: Hic est rex Judæorum.
verses.english: There was also an inscription over Him, written in Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: “This is the King of the Jews.”

verses.latin: Unus autem ex his, qui pendebant, latronibus, blasphemabat eum, dicens: Si tu es Christus, salvum fac temetipsum et nos.
verses.english: One of the criminals hanging there blasphemed Him, saying, “Are You not the Christ? Save Yourself and us!”

verses.latin: Respondens autem alter, increpabat eum, dicens: Neque tu times Deum, quod in eadem damnatione es?
verses.english: But the other one rebuked him, saying, “Do you not fear God, seeing you are under the same condemnation?

verses.latin: Et nos quidem juste, nam digna factis recipimus: hic vero nihil mali fecit.
verses.english: And we indeed justly, for we are receiving the due reward of our deeds, but this man has done nothing wrong.”

verses.latin: Et dicebat ad Jesum: Domine, memento mei, cum veneris in regnum tuum.
verses.english: And he said to Jesus, “Lord, remember me when You come into Your kingdom.”

verses.latin: Et dixit illi Jesus: Amen dico tibi, hodie mecum eris in paradiso.
verses.english: And Jesus said to him, “Truly, I say to you, today you will be with Me in Paradise.”

verses.latin: Et erat fere hora sexta, et tenebræ factæ sunt in universam terram usque in horam nonam.
verses.english: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness fell over the whole land until the ninth hour.

verses.latin: Et obscuratus est sol, et velum templi scissum est medium.
verses.english: The sun was obscured, and the curtain of the temple was torn in two.

verses.latin: Et clamans voce magna Jesus, ait: Pater, in manus tuas commendo spiritum meum. Et hæc dicens, expiravit.
verses.english: And Jesus, crying out with a loud voice, said, “Father, into Your hands I commit My spirit.” And having said this, He breathed His last.

verses.latin: Videns autem centurio quod factum fuerat, glorificavit Deum, dicens: Vere hic homo justus erat.
verses.english: When the centurion saw what had happened, he glorified God, saying, “Certainly this man was innocent.”

verses.latin: Et omnes turba eorum, qui simul aderant ad spectaculum istud, et videbant quæ fiebant, percutientes pectora sua, revertebantur.
verses.english: And all the crowds that had assembled for this spectacle, seeing what had taken place, returned home, beating their breasts.

verses.latin: Et stabant omnes noti ejus a longe, et mulieres, quæ secutæ eum erant a Galilæa, videntes hæc.
verses.english: And all His acquaintances, and the women who had followed Him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.

verses.latin: Et ecce vir nomine Joseph, qui erat de Arimathæa, civitate Judæorum: qui erat et ipse bonus et justus:
verses.english: And behold, a man named Joseph, who was from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, a good and righteous man,

verses.latin: (qui non consenserat consilio, et actibus eorum), qui exspectabat et ipse regnum Dei,
verses.english: who had not agreed to their plan and action, and he was waiting for the kingdom of God,

verses.latin: hic accessit ad Pilatum, et petiit corpus Jesu.
verses.english: this man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.

verses.latin: Et depositum, involvit sindone, et posuit in monumento exciso, in quo nondum quisquam positus fuerat.
verses.english: He took it down and wrapped it in a linen shroud and laid Him in a tomb cut into the rock, where no one had ever been laid.

verses.latin: Et dies erat parasceves, et sabbatum illucescebat.
verses.english: It was the day of Preparation, and the Sabbath was beginning.

verses.latin: Subsecutæ autem mulieres, quæ cum eo venerant de Galilæa, viderunt monumentum, et quomodo positum erat corpus ejus.
verses.english: The women who had come with Him from Galilee followed and saw the tomb and how His body was laid.

verses.latin: Reversæ autem, parave-runt aromata, et unguenta. Et sabbato quidem siluerunt secundum mandatum.
verses.english: Then they returned and prepared spices and ointments. And on the Sabbath they rested, according to the commandment.

verses.latin: Et die una sabbati, valde diluculo, venerunt ad monumentum,portantes aromata quae paraverant.
verses.english: Very early on the first day of the week, the women went to the tomb, bringing the spices they had prepared.

verses.latin: Et invenerunt lapidem revolutum a monumento.
verses.english: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb.

verses.latin: Et ingressae non invenerunt corpus Domini Jesu.
verses.english: They went inside, but they didn't find the body of the Lord Jesus.

verses.latin: Et factum est, dum mente consternatae essent de isto, ecce duo viri stetere secus illas in veste fulgenti.
verses.english: While they were stunned and didn't know what to make of this, two men in shining clothes suddenly stood beside them.

verses.latin: Illis autem timore perterritis, et inclinatis in faciem, dixerunt ad illas: Quid quaeritis viventem cum mortuis?
verses.english: The women were terrified and bowed their faces to the ground. The men asked them, “Why are you looking for the living among the dead?

verses.latin: Non est hic, sed resurrexit. Recordamini qualiter locutus est vobis, cum adhuc in Galilaea esset,
verses.english: He isn't here! He's risen! Remember how he spoke to you while he was still in Galilee,

verses.latin: dicens: Quia oportet Filium hominis tradi in manus hominum peccatorum, et crucifigi, et die tertia resurgere.
verses.english: telling you that the Son of Man must be handed over to the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and rise on the third day?”

verses.latin: Et recordatae sunt verborum ejus.
verses.english: Then they remembered His words.

verses.latin: Et reversae a monumento nuntiaverunt haec omnia undecim, et ceteris omnibus.
verses.english: They returned from the tomb and told all these things to the eleven disciples and to all the others.

verses.latin: Erat autem Maria Magdalene, et Joanna, et Maria Jacobi, et ceteræ quae cum eis erant, quae dicebant ad apostolos haec.
verses.english: It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women with them who told the apostles these things.

verses.latin: Et visa sunt ante illos sicut deliramentum verba ista; et non credebant illis.
verses.english: The apostles thought what the women said was nonsense, and they didn't believe them.

verses.latin: Petrus autem surgens cucurrit ad monumentum: et procumbens vidit linteamina sola posita. Et abiit stupens in semetipso quod factum fuerat.
verses.english: Peter, however, got up and ran to the tomb. He bent down and saw the linen cloths but nothing else. Then he went away, wondering what had happened.

verses.latin: Et ecce ipse in eadem die ibant duo ex illis in castellum, quod erat distans a Jerusalem stadia sexaginta,
verses.english: That same day, two of the disciples were going to a village called Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem,

verses.latin: nomine Emmaus: et ipsi loquebantur ad invicem de his omnibus, quae acciderant.
verses.english: and they were talking with each other about all these things that had happened.

verses.latin: Et factum est, dum fabularentur, et secum quaererent, et ipse Jesus appropinquans, ibat cum illis.
verses.english: As they were talking and discussing, Jesus Himself drew near and walked with them.

verses.latin: Oculi autem illorum tenebantur, ne eum agnoscerent.
verses.english: But their eyes were kept from recognizing Him.

verses.latin: Et ait ad illos: Qui sunt hi sermones, quos confertis ad invicem ambulantes, et estis tristes?
verses.english: He asked them, “What are you discussing with each other as you walk along?” They stopped, looking sad.

verses.latin: Et respondens unus, cui nomen Cleopas, dixit ei: Tu solus peregrinus es in Jerusalem, et non cognovisti quae facta sunt in illa diebus istis?
verses.english: One of them, named Cleopas, asked Him, “Are you the only visitor to Jerusalem who doesn’t know the things that have happened there in these days?”

verses.latin: Quibus ille dixit: Quae? Et dixerunt: De Jesu Nazareno, qui fuit vir propheta, potens in opere et sermone coram Deo et omni populo:
verses.english: He asked them, “What things?” They said, “About Jesus of Nazareth, who was a prophet powerful in word and deed before God and all the people,

verses.latin: et quomodo eum tradiderunt summi sacerdotes et principes nostri in damnationem mortis, et crucifixerunt eum.
verses.english: and how our chief priests and leaders handed Him over to be condemned to death, and they crucified Him.

verses.latin: Nos autem sperabamus quia ipse esset redempturus Israël: et nunc super haec omnia, tertia dies est hodie quod haec facta sunt.
verses.english: We had hoped that He was the one who would redeem Israel. And besides all this, it is now the third day since these things happened.

verses.latin: Sed et mulieres quaedam ex nostris terruerunt nos, quae ante lucem fuerunt ad monumentum;
verses.english: Some women of our group have astonished us. They went to the tomb early this morning,

verses.latin: et non invento corpore ejus, venerunt dicentes se etiam visionem angelorum vidisse, qui dicunt eum vivere.
verses.english: and didn't find His body. They came back saying they had even seen a vision of angels, who said He was alive.

verses.latin: Et abierunt quidam ex nostris ad monumentum: et ita invenerunt sicut mulieres dixerant, ipsum vero non viderunt.
verses.english: Some of those with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said, but they did not see Him.”

verses.latin: Et ipse dixit ad eos: O stulti et tardi corde ad credendum in omnibus quae locuti sunt prophetae!
verses.english: Then Jesus said to them, “You foolish people! You are slow to believe all that the prophets have spoken!

verses.latin: Nonne haec oportuit pati Christum, et ita intrare in gloriam suam?
verses.english: Didn’t the Christ have to suffer these things and then enter His glory?”

verses.latin: Et incipiens a Moyse, et omnibus prophetis, interpretabatur illis in omnibus Scripturis, quae de ipso erant.
verses.english: And beginning with Moses and all the prophets, He interpreted to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning Himself.

verses.latin: Et appropinquaverunt ad castellum quo ibant: et ipse se finxit longius ire.
verses.english: As they approached the village to which they were going, Jesus acted as if He were going farther.

verses.latin: Et coëgerunt eum, dicentes: Mane nobiscum, quoniam advesperascit, et inclinata est jam dies. Et intravit cum illis.
verses.english: But they urged Him, saying, “Stay with us, because it is almost evening and the day is nearly over.” So He went in to stay with them.

verses.latin: Et factum est, dum recumberet cum eis, accepit panem, et benedixit, et fregit, et porrigebat illis.
verses.english: When He was at the table with them, He took bread, gave thanks, broke it, and began to give it to them.

verses.latin: Et eorum aperti sunt oculi, et cognoverunt eum: et ipse evanuit ex oculis eorum.
verses.english: Then their eyes were opened, and they recognized Him. But He vanished from their sight.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ad invicem: Nonne cor nostrum ardens erat in nobis dum loqueretur in via, et aperiret nobis Scripturas?
verses.english: They said to each other, “Were not our hearts burning within us while He was speaking to us on the road, while He was opening the Scriptures to us?”

verses.latin: Et surgentes ipsa hora regressi sunt in Jerusalem: et invenerunt congregatos undecim, et eos qui cum illis erant,
verses.english: They got up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem. They found the eleven disciples and those with them gathered together,

verses.latin: dicentes: Quod surrexit Dominus vere, et apparuit Simoni.
verses.english: and they were saying, “The Lord has truly risen and has appeared to Simon!”

verses.latin: Et ipsi narrabant quae gesta erant in via, et quomodo cognoverunt eum in fractione panis.
verses.english: Then the two disciples told what had happened on the road and how they recognized Him when He broke the bread.

verses.latin: Dum haec autem loquuntur, stetit Jesus in medio eorum, et dicit eis: Pax vobis. Ego sum, nolite timere.
verses.english: While they were talking about this, Jesus Himself stood among them and said to them, “Peace to you.” But they were startled and frightened, thinking they were seeing a ghost.

verses.latin: Conturbati autem et conterriti, putabant se spiritum videre.
verses.english: But they were startled and frightened, thinking they were seeing a ghost.

verses.latin: Et dixit eis: Quid turbati estis? et cogitationes ascendunt in corda vestra?
verses.english: He said to them, “Why are you troubled? And why do doubts arise in your hearts?

verses.latin: Videte manus meas et pedes, quia ego ipse sum; palpate et videte, quia spiritus carnem et ossa non habet, sicut me videtis habere.
verses.english: Look at My hands and My feet. It is I Myself! Touch Me and see, because a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you see I have.”

verses.latin: Et cum hoc dixisset, ostendit eis manus et pedes.
verses.english: And when He had said this, He showed them His hands and feet.

verses.latin: Adhuc autem illis non credentibus prae gaudio, et mirantibus, dixit: Habetis hic aliquid quod manducetur?
verses.english: Because they still did not believe for joy, and were astonished, He said to them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”

verses.latin: At illi obtulerunt ei partem piscis assi, et favum mellis.
verses.english: They gave Him a piece of broiled fish, and some honeycomb.

verses.latin: Et cum manducasset coram eis, assumpsit.
verses.english: He took it and ate it in front of them.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eos: Haec sunt verba quae locutus sum ad vos cum adhuc essem vobiscum, quoniam necesse est impleri omnia quae scripta sunt in lege Moysi, et prophetis, et in Psalmis de me.
verses.english: Then He said to them, “These are the words that I spoke to you while I was still with you: Everything written about Me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets, and the Psalms must be fulfilled.”

verses.latin: Tunc aperuit illis sensum ut intelligerent Scripturas.
verses.english: Then He opened their minds to understand the Scriptures.

verses.latin: Et dixit eis: Quoniam sic scriptum est, et sic oportebat Christum pati, et resurgere a mortuis tertia die:
verses.english: He told them, “This is what is written: The Christ must suffer and rise from the dead on the third day,

verses.latin: et praedicari in nomine ejus poenitentiam et remissionem peccatorum in omnes gentes, initium facientes ab Jerusalem.
verses.english: and repentance and forgiveness of sins must be preached in His name to all nations, beginning from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Vos autem testes horum estis.
verses.english: You are witnesses of these things.

verses.latin: Et ecce ego mitto promissum Patris mei in vos; vos autem sedete in civitate, quoadusque induamini virtute ex alto.
verses.english: And look, I am sending the promise of My Father upon you. But stay in the city until you are clothed with power from on high.”

verses.latin: Eduxit autem eos foras in Bethaniam: et levatis manibus suis benedixit eis.
verses.english: Then He led them out as far as Bethany, and He lifted up His hands and blessed them.

verses.latin: Et factum est, dum benediceret illis, recessit ab eis, et ferebatur in caelum.
verses.english: As He was blessing them, He departed from them and was carried up into the universe.

verses.latin: Et ipsi adorantes regressi sunt in Jerusalem cum gaudio magno:
verses.english: And they worshiped Him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,

verses.latin: et erant semper in templo, laudantes et benedicentes Deum. Amen.
verses.english: and they were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
